reviews.review_text: Love this little guy for what it's worth !! And if you have some time on your hands save the little box inside and get creative! Make a little sub box lol

Purchased Anker product to replace old computer speakers connected to Dell laptop as well as to eliminate the need for headphones or earbuds on tablet with anemic speaker. Speaker would show as connected to laptop, sounded fine (albeit a tad bass-y), but was in perpetual blink mode. When listening to talk radio stream or spoken audio files (such as guided meditations or yoga routines), the audio clipped. While online, moving between tabs caused the audio to stutter. Couldn't get the speaker to pair with tablet or for it to be recognized using audio cable (Panasonic headphones and Sony earbuds connect with no issues). Anker provided a replacement but speaker continues to blink when used with laptop unless added/removed with each use which shouldn't be necessary. Was able to get replacement speaker paired with tablet but still unable to get it to work on tablet when connected using audio cable. The speaker crackles, the headphone icon appears for a second and then nothing. Surprised to be given the 'low battery' warning after having used speaker in actual BT mode for barely a handful of hours. Perhaps all the connection and pairing attempts took their toll. Fortunately, it recharged rather quickly. Speaker is insanely too loud. Been blasted more than a few times, when connecting, so have to remember to take volume setting down to zero and then tweak to about 5-8% which is sufficiently loud if within several feet. At 15-20% my entire apt bldg would be given an earful. After too many hours spent troubleshooting, I'm done trying to figure out why I'm not enjoying this product in the same way those of the 'glowing reviews' are. Bottom line: will use the Anker speaker via BT with tablet and with audio cable with laptop. Finally, have a much-loved laptop remote which allows for adjusting volume from some distance (great for when doing workout videos). Unfortunately, trying to use it in combination with the Anker speaker, when connected via BT, cancelled out the BT. (Not particularly tech savvy but can appreciate how this might happen.) So, in some respects, using the speaker with the cable on the laptop still affords the ability to adjust the volume from across the room versus having to be within arm's reach of the keyboard as required by the Anker speaker.

Incredibly tiny. Like most folks who have purchased this, you have initial doubts about sound quality, but those were quickly dispersed. Amazingly loud for such a little speaker. Pairs easily. I like the grippy surface on the bottom of it - makes it easy to sit on my dash and doesn't move at all. This would slip easily into a jacket pocket - and maybe into some baggy pants. Just incredibly handy if you are out and about and have a desire to listen to something on your phone, especially if you're sharing it with someone else. Controls are dead simple - just push the "on" button.

reviews.review_header: Died after 3 months of light use (Update: Anker support rocks!)
reviews.review_text: I got this very nice speaker on April 13th. Initially, I was amazed by the battery life and ease of use. Unfortunately, the speaker is a brick now. It will stay with the red light (charging) for hours and never come out of it. I tried several chargers, but nothing brings the speaker back to life. I'm sad because this is the first Anker product that fails me (I have Anker portable batteries, solar chargers, etc.). Update: After posting my review, I was contacted by Anker support. They sent me a replacement speaker. I wanted to wait for some time before claiming victory. After a few months, the new speaker is still working, so I've updated my review from 1-start to 4-stars, as Anker stands behind their products.

reviews.review_header: Amazing sound and battery power in a really tiny package.
reviews.review_text: Bought this item on the strength of the Anker name (love their power banks and charging cables) and a little bit of spec sheet comparison. I was looking at units 4 times as large that put out 4 watts and 6-8 hours of bluetoothand found out this mighty mite put out 3 watts and 12 hours of bluetooth and it's small enough to forget that you have it in your jacket pocket or bag. It really is the size and shape of a ring box. Got it out and put it on the charger. Red led in power button says it's charging. Red flashing means low battery. Red light goes off when fully charged. Pairing with nfc is super easy. Push and hold power button for three seconds and light in power button starts flashing blue. Touch my Samsung s5 active to anker logo on top and phone asks if I want to pair it. Click yes and it's done. Now the part everyone wants to know about, how loud and how good does it sound? First It is NOT a thumping bass monster. It is not realistic to expect that from a speaker 1 1/4" in diameter (approx). It does however fill a good sized living room 15 x 18' approximately with nice clear sound. It has stronger mid and highs but all in all it has little distortion and let me repeat it is a TINY little speaker. For its size and weight it sounds phenomenal. Appearance and construction. Design is clean and elegant. Small vent holes around bottom help balance air flow and sound of speaker. It has its main speaker grill on top with a tasteful grey anker logo justified left center. The front has a small combination power button and indicator light just below the center of the front panel. The back has a female micro - usb port in the mirror of the power button position. It operates as both a charging port and with the included adapter cable an input from your 3.5mm stereo output to the speaker if your device does not have bluetooth. The bottom of the speaker has full coverage rubber to keep it from moving around on its own. I also suspect it hides the fasteners that hold the speaker together because no fasteners are evident anywhere on the speaker. I just don't want to peel it loose to see. I haven't tested battery life, but past experience with Anker products gives me confidence that it will be in the ballpark of the 12 hours they promise. I found only one SERIOUS down side to this little speaker. While a guy can forget he has this in his pocket, the females of the species are trained from birth to notice objects of this particular size and shape. They can become highly emotional and upset when they find it is not a new toy for them from Tiffany, DeBeers, or Zale's but is instead a new tech toy for you. For some reason they act as if it was an intentional act of provocation. Seriously though this speaker is a worth while choice for anyone looking for a speaker that is truly tiny but packs a good deal of punch. I'm giving it 5 stars because even though it lacks bass and stereo sound when judged for what it is...it is simply astounding. Good job Anker. You knocked this one out of the park.

I love this pocket sized wireless speaker. Its very small ~ a tiny 1.6" x 1.6" inch cube, it will fit in the palm of your hand, your pocket, purse or briefcase; but the sound is REALLY BIG. I was amazed by the quality, clarity and depth of the sound. I was so ecstatic, I went back and purchased 3 more. The price was a fraction of what I paid for a much larger, name brand, wireless speaker last year; the sound on the Anker Ultra Portable Pocket size speaker is far better. Spent less but got so much more. It pairs perfectly with my Amazon Echo Dot and the music is phenomenal.

No much bass sound but the quality of sound overall is good. I bought this box for less than $20 and because of the price vs quality I give this product 4/5 stars. If you like loud bass sounds this is not the right device but if you want a portable wireless speaker, easy to pair with Apple products this is it! The battery last long over 8 hours and the exterior feels nice its rubber cover makes it looks fancy! Sound: 4/5 Appearance: 5/5 Battery: 5/5 Performance: 5/5

reviews.review_header: Sounds even smaller than it looks.
reviews.review_text: Like some other reviewers, I was shocked when I first heard how this thing sounds in person. Unlike those other reviewers, I was shocked that an audio product with such high reviews could sound so unlistenably bad. Sure, it's no bigger than a piece of sushi, but if it can't even sound better than the cell phone it's paired to (it doesn't) why does it even exist? Volume is pretty loud, but the sound is so piercing and so shrill you'd never want to have it turned up all the way. I returned the Anker because in addition to the terrible sound, it had trouble staying paired to devices. Instead, I ended up with JBL Micro Wireless Ultra-Portable Speaker with Wireless Bluetooth Connectivity (White) , and am very happy I sacrificed a few valuable square centimeters of packing space for vastly better sound. The whole JBL Micro / Clip line sounds worlds better than the Anker -- and they might even be lighter, despite being slightly larger. It's neat that Anker made a speaker this small. But it turns out they shouldn't have.

I looked at the speaker both on the Anker site and the Amazon site. I bought it from Amazon because I'm a Prime member so I got free shipping as opposed to several bucks on Anker. I realize that it's a small speaker. But, when I opened the box and took out the speaker, I couldn't believe it. It's just a tiny bit larger than those wooden alphabet blocks that children play with. I turned on the speaker and it immediately paired with my iPhone 6. It came with almost a full charge so it was ready to play right out of the box. But I plugged in the charger for about an hour and now it's fully charged. It comes with a USB to Micro USB charging cable. It also has a Micro USB to audio plug so you can plug it in to a non-Bluetooth radio or whatever music source you want to use. Finally, it comes with a soft cloth bag so you can safely throw it in your backpack or briefcase or purse without having to worry about scratches and dings. I picked out a Bruce Springsteen concert from August 23, 2016 to try out the speaker. I also have the Anker SoundCore speaker and I couldn't tell any difference in the sound. It really is a great ultra portable speaker that you can easily carry anywhere and play music from your smartphone. With the twelve hour battery life before the next charge, you can use it just about the entire day with no problem. This speaker gets my highest recommendation.

reviews.review_header: This little speaker is absolutely exceptional!!!!
reviews.review_text: Where to begin? This little speaker is absolutely exceptional and right out of the box it will blow your mind! Personally I have never been so satisfied with something I have bought as I have been with this speaker. First the packaging itself is very appealing and ensure that the item is safe, furthermore the setup alone can literally be done in seconds when pairing to a phone via Bluetooth or NFC. Both Android and Apple devices pick up the speaker almost immediately and before you know it they are paired. The build quality of the device is also brilliant, soft to the touch yet very durable and offers such an simplistic look which results in a rather unique and elegant look. The sound further adds to the uniqueness of this device as hands down it is one of the best in its class and to be honest could easily compare with other bigger devices. The sound is crisp and clear as well as offering a very well balanced sound with decent bass which will easily tantalize your ear buds in wanting to listen more and more. Even from a distance the sound is still exceptionally clear and while testing the range in an office building with lots of interference be it WIFI, Walls, AC’s and various other signal forms and moving from one end to the other, the device never lost signal and sound was as clear as ever. Overall this little speaker is well worth the price tag and will meet your expectations and then some more. I showed it to a friend who within a few minutes of looking at it and hearing it, immediately went online and bought one. PROS: Affordability Portability Sound Quality Build Quality Battery Duration Enjoyment & Excitability Showoffability (If that’s even a word) – Trust everyone who sees this little speaker is blown away CONS: I’m sure there are other people who have CONS when it comes to this speaker but to be honest, for what it is it’s perfect. My only thing I don’t like is that it’s a Finger print magnet but alas it can be cleaned so it’s not such a big issue. If you are looking for a simple yet very effective portable speaker.....Look no further as this is all you need!!!!

reviews.review_header: Its good as long as the audio on the recording is ...
reviews.review_text: Its good as long as the audio on the recording is good because there's no volume control on the speaker. Edit: It's a good thing that this speaker has the ability to hard wire, because after I used it 3 times, it doesn't pick up the bluetooth any more. Somehow I ended up with 2 of these, and was charged for both of them. I don't care for them. I ordered this one and the larger 7908 model to see which one I liked the best. I like the 7908 better. It does have a volume control on it, and sounds a lot better, but it doesn't go very loud either. As long as the original recording is at a decent volume, it's great, but if not, not so great. I wish I could return these 2 small speakers and get 1 more of the 7908 speakers.

This speaker is very premium feeling, constructed of a soft touch material. It only has one button, which is used for power a play/pause. On the back there is a micro USB port for charging at 0.5 A. It is a very compact speaker, and it easily fits in my hand. It only weighs 3.17 ounces. But don’t let the size deceive you. It really has incredible sound for its size. The highs sound very clear. But as expected, there is not that much bass. But that’s not surprising given its very compact size. I mount it on my bike for portable listening and it sounds clear and very loud. In addition to being very portable, the speaker is very durable. I have dropped it multiple times and it still works perfectly, only receiving some minor scuffs on the outside. On top of all of this, the battery life is very good. It last a long time on full volume. It also charges very quick if you make sure to use a high quality charging cable. I recommend this speaker to anyone who wants an extremely portable speaker. If you want to sacrifice portability for sound, there is many speakers by Anker that aren’t that much more expensive.

reviews.review_header: Even though it sounds great when playing music for a little cube
reviews.review_text: After I used up the whole battery, it died out. I recharged it and it would not work again. I left a negative review and received a new one and deleted the review. The same thing has happened again after 6 month or so. I don't use this so often and it is a bummer that it happened the second time. Even though it sounds great when playing music for a little cube, it is not worth it if you use it up then dies and will not work again.

reviews.review_header: Cute but MUCH better Tiny Speakers Out There
reviews.review_text: NOTE: I'd like to mention the wonderful Customer Service of Anker. After posting my not-so-glowing review, I was contacted by the company and they offered me a full refund. This goes a LONG WAY toward my positive feelings about Anker. I wish them all the best in future product development. And this was an unsolicited "Thank You", from me. ****************************************************************************************************************************************** "Hi. My name is Pie Grrrl and I'm a Bluetooth-A-Holic." There, I admitted it. I must own over 20 different types of Bluetooth speakers: from very large non-portable ones, to large Bose portable, to light-bulbs with speakers and a plethora of small, hand-sized ones. Some I've gotten through Vine to review but the majority I've just purchased outright. "Why???", you have the right to ask, "WHY so many darn Bluetooth speakers?" Simple, I'm of the ancient age where the Magical Mystery of having two unconnected devices create SOUND...glorious SOUND...in my presence still amazes me and leaves me awestruck! I'm from that Ancient Age of Mankind where you hauled your RECORD PLAYER outside with a lonnnng extension cord from the garage, in order to listen to tunes from your 45 rpm and 78 rpm record collection. So, the fact that a playing-card sized smart phone can transmit music to a ring-box sized speaker just gob-smacks me and will continue to do so for the remainder of my life. I travel extensively for my work so the smaller something is and the less weight it is, it becomes a Bonus for my aching back and the Drag It Around Factor at the end of a grueling day of landscaping. I already have 2-3 preferred small speakers (size of a Twinkie) that I use daily, but when I saw the photos for this speaker and read/watched the videos of it's performance, well....I was "One-Click" away from yet another Bluetooth speaker. It arrived in record time, well wrapped in a bubble-wrapped paper mailing envelope. The exceedingly sturdy cardboard box came with a slip-off cover. The wee speaker was inside of the box with the pictured cables and a guide to set up. After a couple of days of use, here's my impressions: 1) Not my favourite small speaker but it gets points for how LOUD it really will broadcast sound. It beats the pants off of ALL of my other tiny Bluetooth speakers with the ability to blast out sound. However, since I NEVER listen to music that loud when I'm by myself, the need for that volume is lost on me. I have much better speakers for parties when I need large quality sound. 2) Compared to my other speakers, this is bare bones, no frills of any kind technology. I have small speakers that "speak", saying they are "Now Connected" and "Goodbye" when you disconnect. I have small speakers that have tiny carry bags; this came with NOTHING. I have tiny speakers that either have a lanyard or a carabiner clip so that you can keep track of them: this has NOTHING! 3) Indicator light: ALL of my other speakers have at least some sophistication in the light department: they either have a very complicated and well-thought out light system indicating the degree of charging or a different blinking system whilst charging. This speaker has the World's Smallest RED light indicating it's charging and a chronic flashing blue-light whilst playing....WHY???? To me, the constant 4-times-per-second blinking light simply drains the battery: if you can't tell that you speaker is playing music while listening to it, the microscopic blinking light ain't gonna help. 4) Sound quality: yes, I realize it's 'wee' but it's almost too heavy on the treble and non-existent on the lower tones. I've set it on a hard surface where it was un-listenable and a soft surface (mouse-pad) where it dampened down the high notes and made it more pleasant. Bottom line: I own better speakers and for about the same amount of money. Yes, it's as Cute As The Dickens, for being so teeny-tiny and I gave it major props for that, but the fact that it came with NO carry case, no lanyard and is behind the times in built-in notifications, I'm giving it 3 stars. Wish I could do 3.5 but amazon doesn't allow it.

reviews.review_header: The item is great, it even has a microphone to take calls ...
reviews.review_text: The item is great, it even has a microphone to take calls while you listen. I purchased this along with the https://www.amazon.com/Anker-SoundCore-Super-Portable-Bluetooth-Hands-Free/dp/B01E724CL4/ref=pd_sim_23_1?ie=UTF8&psc=1&refRID=0EHR9HWFSQ3NM4WSR459 Anker SoundCore nano, Super-Portable Bluetooth Speaker. Personally I prefer the Ultra Portable one. It works out because my brother like this nano better so I gave it to him. The nano and ultra both have similar sounds. I think the other one sounded a little better. I liked the color options of the ultra better. The nano is a little smaller. The surface area of a face is a little bigger however it is flatter. I would say that the nano takes up less space. Both are great products however. So basically the nano has newer bluetooth, microphone for phone calls and it is flatter taking up less physical area. The ultra has Better colors, longer battery life, and has a smaller surface area but is a bit longer. Can't go wrong with either one. just colors and battery life gave be the edge over the newer bluetooth and microphone.

reviews.review_header: OKAY for price point but tinny sounding
reviews.review_text: easy on/off simple button and NICE size/comes with string tie bag for storage when not in use; good price; will keep due to overall value but would not use long term as the sound quality is just FAIR (tinny sounding) Additional Review Comments a few weeks later after contact with ANKER Customer Service: They contacted me after seeing my review/disappointment and suggested that I try the upgrade, (the "Classic" Bluetooth speaker which is a bit bigger at 3" squared); they let me keep the smaller one and sent me the upgrade at no charge (I am grateful for the opportunity to try it) charge which is exceptionally good customer service/this does not happen too often where they contact you instead of you contacting them so huge kudos to them on excellent service; I have been using the new speaker and whilst it does have significantly better sound (very crisp/sharp/clear), there is still some tinniness that I can detect but I am also very particular with audio/sound and 95% of folks won't pick up on what I do; it could use a little more bass and less treble; overall, (I got the white one) it is a BEAUTIFULLY designed piece, has a nice weight/in the Goldilocks Zone(not too light or too heavy), and the texture of the materials used feel like high quality (very smooth/like satin when you hold/touch it); I like the added features of volume control/pause/play on the unit itself as the smaller one does not have this; as new products come out, I think the ANKER small/speaker will only improve the sound thus I will consider them again in the future due to their awareness/conscientious of product and exceptional quality/customer service

reviews.review_header: Great little complimentary device used to upgrade your laptop, phone, or tablet speakers
reviews.review_text: The main reason you want to buy this speaker is because Anker makes reliable products, the sound is great, its bluetooth and the size is adorable. The box design is great since you can put it on just about anything and you can bet it wont roll off. You wont be able to put it in your pocket though. The sound is great for its size but there is some minor issues - there is some bass lacking, obviously. This is a speaker that isnt meant to be a main speaker like a UE BOOM. Its just a small tool you can use with you another device you carry around. I use this to compliment my laptop speakers, Its easy to setup and the sound surpasses my laptops. The sound is clear and its great for listening to youtube videos and listening to audiobooks on my laptop when i am exercising in my room. I can always put on itunes or spotify and it sounds great with the little speaker near you. Since i have other bluetooth speakers, that sound way batter, and are bigger, i dont use it to be my main bluetooth speaker. I use it to carry around and if i need to show my friend a video, i can just whip this little cutie out and get some great audio.

reviews.review_header: You won't believe it any more than I did
reviews.review_text: I do not generally review items on Amazon but I felt obligated to do it for this amazing speaker which I am currently listening to. From the picture, I was expecting something like a 4" cube. When it arrived in a little box, I thought I should have read the product description more closely; it clearly says it's a 1.8 inch cube. I was prepared for a tinny, disappointing little sound. After easily connecting it via Bluetooth, it went on and I was amazed. Shocked really. The sound is as good as speakers many, many times it's miniature size. Not sure how they did it, but Anker deserves enormous credit for this achievement. Full, rich tones. I now have the speaker across the room hidden behind a small plate; the sound is filling my entire room. I can't recommend this product enough.

reviews.review_header: This is strictly a speaker, no mic, but it is great little product!
reviews.review_text: I bought this little thing to be able to listen to music while working at a warehouse. I was using my phone but it would drain the battery fairly quickly. I jerry-rigged a keychain holder to put this around my neck and I love it. The speaker really is small. I swear you could hide it inside a coke can without a problem. It comes with a micro-USB charging cable and a 3.5 mic to micro-USB cable to connect to non-bluetooth devices. It also comes with a pouch to carry it all. I was not expecting much from such a little speaker but the sound is very good. It is a far cry from something like Bose but it is definitely better than stock phone or computer speakers. It only has one button to power it on/off and for pairing. Volume is controlled using the volume on your phone, computer, tablet or other device. I found that the best place to listen to it was by placing it close to you by your desk so it is almost under your head or laying down so that the speaker is facing you. I used an equalizer to tune the sound more to my taste by you have to understand this is a single speaker so you will not get real stereo sound from it. Continuous playing at mid volume provides approx 5-6 hours of playing time. It does not have a mic so you cannot use it for phone calls. This is strictly a speaker. For what it is, this little guy does a good job. I am not wowed by it but it does the job I got it for well. If you want more sound you will have to spend more money but if you want something much better than your device's stock speakers more oomph to the music you can't go wrong with this.

reviews.review_header: Impressive little thing for the price
reviews.review_text: Pretty butt-kickin' little speaker - for the size of the thing, it's impressive. No, it doesn't sound as full as your home stereo, but for drinking on the deck and playing "find funky old music videos on the iPad" (a really fun game - someone always goes for the Rick James) it's just fine. My wife uses it in her private yoga teaching gigs to stream music from her phone. Some of these cheap little bluetooths are a real pain, dropped connections or they suddenly let out a big roar from your cabinet or purse... this is a decent implementation, and cheap as hell.

reviews.review_header: FANTASTIC. Sound/Battery Life are incredible for this size.
reviews.review_text: OMG...the sound this things makes is incredible....and battery life is ALL DAY. I was looking for a solution to play music at fests and other outdoor events. Recently took it to an Oktoberfest. Sound quality was fantastic playing right off my cell phone (bluetooth). At one point, over the din of the outdoor fest, the fest coordinator asked us to "turn our music down." That should indicate how much sound this pumps out. Battery lasted from dawn to dusk without any effect and went on again the next day...well over 14 hrs total. It is totally portable and about the size of a ring box (as described). I call it my "pocket Ompah Band." Note: Bought this on recommendation from a friend that has the larger model. I went for this smaller model for size. It is actually as loud as the larger model and runs just as long (side by side test)...for LESS MONEY and in a smaller form factor. Anker really got this right. (No...I am not a paid spokesperson.)

Don't be fooled by the size. Footprint-wise, I can't imagine a Bluetooth speaker being any smaller. That being said, the sound quality is great. It's not going to blow you away or anything, and it's definitely lacking some fullness, but if all you're looking for is a small step up from your laptop or phone offering without being too cumbersome, this is probably your best option. It fits in any normal-sized pocket. I got this as a gift, and the recipient only uses it through Bluetooth, so I can't speak for the NFC quality. But through Bluetooth, these start to crackle around 75%. They sound pretty good up to then, but regardless of the track, device, or track source, these will max out pretty easily. I would've liked if anker had done a little better on controlling this. Even at 75% though, these are pretty loud and adequate for any light to medium ambient noise. Even though the speaker only faces one direction, as long as it isn't facing a surface it's got great clarity and volume. Next to speakers up to 3 times its size, it can get just as loud (although rarely as full or bassy of course). The buttons are clicky, good quality, and easy to use.

This speaker delivers great sound quality for a reasonable price. It is also the least light polluting model of speaker I could find (I listen to podcasts at night when falling asleep and a bunch of blinking flashing speaker lights drive can drive me nuts!). That being said, some of its touted features I just don't like. It's so small that it's easily knocked over and can be hard to find if you're a clutter queen like me. I charge using an Anker cord and the cord is so stiff and the speaker is so light that even brushing the cord can knock it off the desk. Also, I know it's supposed to be all about simplicity but not having any kind of volume controls can be irritating, especially when that means I have to completely open and wake back up my laptop at night to do so. I do think this speaker is worth purchasing though. Some of those complaints are probably just me specific and they don't outweigh the reasonable price, good sound quality, or ease of use. This speaker was easy to set up and synced easily to my older laptop that had had problems syncing with other speakers before.

Lots of sound for such a little thing. The manual says not to, but it plays and charges at the same time which is great. My routine is: * Sit at my desk * Hold the power button until it flips on * It beeps to say my laptop is connected to it * Play some music and start working It almost always works on the first try, but I blame bluetooth more than anything, as I have a keyboard, mouse, and speaker, and there's occasional connectivity issues with all 3.

reviews.review_header: Great little speaker for the price
reviews.review_text: Great little speaker for the price, hard to beat. Build quality and material seems better than most portable speakers 5/5. Audio Quality is 3.5/5. Overall seems a little boosted in the mid-range which is something to consider. For listening to podcasts or talk radio, it's absolutely perfect though, because vocals will come through loud and fill up a room. For most music it will do a good job too, because thankfully and most importantly for a (inexpensive) little speaker, it's real loud. Functionality I give a 4/5. The one problem with the design is that unless you're connected via Bluetooth, you simply cannot use it while it's charging. Most portable speakers will charge and play audio through a split cable, or use two separate inputs. This speaker comes with one USB port and two separate cables. I usually keep a portable USB battery charging pack on me. Ideally I could keep the speaker on and re-charging while still listening, but that's not the case here. The (Sansa Clip) MP3 player I use only has a headphone output- no Bluetooth, and many people are in the same boat. Other than that issue, I do recommend this speaker because it seems built to last, unlike most others in it's class.

reviews.review_header: Great for travel when you want to save space and weight.
reviews.review_text: I bought this to take with me to Europe so I could have some of my music playing in my hotel rooms while I was getting ready or planning the day's itinerary. This is truly a super small speaker, but it feels solid and has a nice rubberized casing. It paired easily with my iPhone and the sound was loud and of good quality for a speaker this size. You're not going to get anything near what you might get with a Jambox, but if space and weight are at a premium, this performed just as good or better than just about any other ultra portable speaker I've tried.

I've had this for a few months now and just love it. I wanted something tiny to take with me on my hikes so I could play my music out loud during those times when I'm hiking at a secluded area, in order to keep mountain lions, coyotes, cows, and snakes away. (I don't actually know that this theory actually works but it makes sense to me that if I make noise, animals are more likely to hear me coming and keep their distance.) We had the larger version of this speaker and I didn't care for it. For one, it was too big for my purposes. For another, the plug to attach to my ishuffle kept getting loose from the speaker outlet so I was constantly fidgeting with it. (I would've returned it had i realized the problem before the the return date expired.) I haven't had any problems with the outlet on this mini-version. And the speaker is so lightweight and small (smaller than a tennis ball), that it is very convenient to carry. I keep it in the included pouch and just tie it to my utility belt since I hate carrying things in my pockets. I never even have to take it out of the pouch because I can access the on/off button right through the fabric. For my purposes, the sound is just fine and it has plenty of volume for even outdoor listening. I also love that it tells you when the battery is getting is low and makes a sound when you turn it off so you know it's off. Totally recommend if you want something with a small footprint.

I have three different brands of Bluetooth speaker, and now this little gem. I regularly use my others around the house, and am satisfied with them, but I will be taking an extended trip this summer and wanted something small enough to fit in my sure-to-be-bulging luggage. Any woman who travels can relate, I'm sure. :D When I searched for small Bluetooth speakers on Amazon, I was surprised at how many of them there are. I read all the reviews and decided to try this one. I am truly amazed! I wasn't expecting much in the way of sound quality in something this small, but I am very pleased with the sound. I was also happy that it arrived charged up and ready to use. I've listened to it for a couple of hours now and forced myself to pack it away. The reviews say it fully charges in less than a couple of hours but I don't want to arrive at my vacation destination and have to immediately charge it up. My only negative comment is that evidently there is no way to know how much battery us left until the speaker announces 'low battery'. But then again, maybe there's a way that I just don't know yet. At any rate, this little speaker seems to be perfect in every way so far, and oh, by the way, you can't beat the price either! I HIGHLY recommend this to anybody looking for a tiny but quality Bluetooth speaker.

reviews.review_header: Good for travel, useless for audiobooks
reviews.review_text: PROS Loud pretty clear sound Tiny Good battery life Fast charging NFC Automatic turn off if disconnected from Bluetooth CONS No depth to sound No microphone or play/next buttons Doesn't play audiobooks smoothly Basically, it sounds better from afar than up close and it can get much louder than my devices but the actually audio quality isn't much of a step up. My old altec orbit sounds better (but is not Bluetooth, and also is larger). And it's pretty useless via Bluetooth for audiobooks, they don't play smoothly and words get eaten up by the stops. I rarely listen to audiobooks via speaker but it would be nice to have the choice. It works well enough for my purposes but I'll look elsewhere next time.

Heartily Recommend: Dancing in the kitchen? Singing in the shower? Want to pocket a speaker and go for a bike ride or a walk? This is your affordable little gadget. MUCH better than ANY other Bluetooth speakers we have tried. - Connects wirelessly to all of our Bluetooth enabled devices - Re-charges and turns back on quickly when I've played it's battery out - Plays even when plugged in to wall outlet and charging. (*but not when plugged into computer) One little CAVEAT: If you have the volume cranked up loud, this mini BOOM-box can bounce itself right off the counter if it's too close to the edge! (Don't worry, it SURVIVED the FOUR-FOOT FALL onto tile floors!) *Note that this speaker does NOT have any option for wired audio input connection, so if you don't have Bluetooth capability, then this one won't work.

reviews.review_header: I use this more than any other BT speaker I own
reviews.review_text: An amazingly good little speaker! Prior reviews said the sound was excellent, but it's even better than I assumed. Yes, it really is a pocket speaker to carry around. No, it won't fill a room with hi-fi, but that's not what it is for. I like to go onto the back deck to listen to the news streaming off my phone, and for that this is perfect. I have a significant hearing loss and it do not have to turn it up all the way to hear quite well. As others have pointed out, its bass response is excellent for such a small unit. No, it won't rattle you cage with booming, but it does sound well balanced. My only wish is that it had volume control on the unit, but I get that Anker wanted to keep it under $20. I use it more than any other BT speaker I own, including a large unit that really will fill most of my house's downstairs with hi-fi. But it's too cumbersome to haul around handily. This one is perfect for 80 percent of my listening needs.

reviews.review_header: Best thing is their customer service!
reviews.review_text: This is honestly not a paid review. Just putting that out there because I'm going to GUSH and I don't want people thinking that I'm not being honest hahaha. First off, I LOVE Anker products. I love them for their durability and convenience/portability. But what I love most is that the company has such great customer service. I had purchased a portable battery before and the cord died like a week later. They sent me a follow up email and when I told them what happened, they sent me a replacement without even me asking! And for this speaker, I don't know what it was but the first one I got didn't hold a charge. Or it didn't show that it was holding it. I have no idea. But anyways, I emailed Anker about it and they sent me another one! Seriously, they have such great customer service that I sometimes wish I had a reason to contact them lmao. Just kidding, but yeah, just go into it knowing that the company at least is very reliable. :D

reviews.review_header: Excellent speaker. The size is perfect!
reviews.review_text: I debated whether to post this as a 4 or 5 star... but after using it for a month or so I believe this is a 5 star product, and here's why: - The size. I'm sure you're tired of hearing this, but you really just have to hold it in your hand to appreciate its size. - Sound quality and volume. Regardless of its size, the sound quality is great. I'm not an audiophile so I can't speak technically, but I played a few unique songs and they sounded mostly great. Now, if you consider its size, the sound quality and volume are AMAZING. The power this little speaker has will blow you away. And it doesn't sound too bad at high volume either. - Battery life. I'm not sure how true it holds to the "12hr" battery life, but I can definitely say it lasts for a long time - Looks. It just looks great. My laptop is also fully black and my mouse is black so everything looks great together. - Durable. I've dropped this thing onto some hard surfaces and everything works as it did on day 1. Now onto the cons. There are two but they are kind of related - I'm not sure what to call this "feature", but it sort of turns off and on during songs. It's hard to explain, but if there is a quiet spot for more than 2 seconds in a song it will sort of power off. I don't believe this is an issue with mine because I've went through 3 of these and they have the same issue. Now 70% this isn't an issue, but sometimes with songs that have a lot of fade-in fade-out, words can get cut off and it's extremely annoying when it happens. I'm assuming this feature saves battery - Buzzing/humming/coil-whine. Again, I've went through 3 of these, and unless all 3 were bad, this is definitely an issue. And it's only an issue through bluetooth. Most people won't hear this or even care. But for me it's slightly annoying. When listening to anything quiet or at moderate volume, you will hear a very very faint whistle. It's not annoying loud and barely noticeable, but that's exactly why it bothers me! I can barely hear it but ITS THERE. To most people this won't even be an issue, but I just really wish the speaker didn't have this faint whistle noise. As you could tell, I'm really picky. I did a lot of reading on reviews and settled on this product, and I am very happy with my purchase. I wish it didn't have the two issues I mentioned above (sound fading/whistling), but other than that, the speaker is phenomenal. The sound quality, battery, volume, size, looks, will impress you. I would recommend this tiny thing!

One of my cords didnt work and they fixed the problem right away . Their costumer service is AMAZING. The product itself is amazing. It might be tiny but the music comes out crystal and clear. I love that it can fit in your pocket. I really recommend them. You wont regret it. Great product. Great costumer service.

reviews.review_header: Great sound out of such a little box!!
reviews.review_text: This speaker is a bit smaller than I expected, but wow is the thing loud and just what I needed! It was purchased to stay in the bathroom since I enjoy listening to music in the shower, and it literally takes up zero room because it fits onto the apple USB plug I have. Great sound out of such a little box!! I've never heard of Anker until recently, but you bet I will buy more products from them in the future. Quality stuff!

reviews.review_header: Well built and surprisingly loud for its size..
reviews.review_text: so what can I say that hasn't already been said..... this speaker is pretty much awesome. I bought it so I could take it with me to conventions and listen to music when its slow or when I am doing sketch commissions. It is really small, fits right into the pocket of my backpack & is perfect for personal use as I have stated. You cant pair it to more than one device which is a bummer, it has to be first unpaired, then repaired to the new device... which is kind of annoying, but after searching multiple products, this seems to be the norm, so if your going to be sharing this thing you have to keep that in mind. The range is great as well. The speaker gets pretty loud, your not going to be entertaining guests or anything... but for its size its nice. As others have stated, you do lose some audio quality when you crank up the volume, but its not meant to rock the house, its a tiny speaker, if you want better sound quality get the slightly larger version. Also worth noting that the build quality is decent... doesn't feel light, or cheap like those small speakers which I have broken before. Made of a hard polymer or resin, outside feels like rubber or silicon... its rather nice. Volume is controlled by the phone, there is no volume control on the speaker, or any controls for that matter, its a very simple yet well built speaker. It also comes with a nice little pouch that I didn't expect to get. Pros - Very Portable, good build quality, pairs easily, good sound quality when used at a moderate volume, good battery life, quick charging speed, good range. carrying pouch included. Cons - can only pair to one device at a time, audio quality loss at highest volume, no speaker controls, All in all, its a nice little speaker. Like I said before as long as your not looking to entertain & you just want a small , adequate & well built speaker for personal use, this one is very nice.

reviews.review_header: Wonderful little speaker. Couldn't be better especially for the price.
reviews.review_text: Disclaimer: I paid full price for this speaker on Amazon. It was not from any coupon or discount program. I have no connection with Anker or Amazon. Now, having said all of that, I can honestly say this really is a spectacular speaker. It's tiny, sounds wonderful, has plenty of volume and the battery lasts forever (at least the advertised 12 hours) between charges. It has paired instantly with my Iphone 6, Ipad and Amazon Dot. Nothing else to say. I mean, how much better could it be :-). Highly recommended. As an aside, I have purchased several Anker products including battery chargers, and a bluetooth keyboard and more. I have never been anything but 100% pleased with any of them. Check my other reviews. Also, please reread the disclaimer at the top of this review. It IS true!

reviews.review_header: Super nice speaker. Professional company. All around great purchase
reviews.review_text: I love this little speaker it's not super big but it's the perfect size for what I need. I wanted to use it for my laptop so it would be louder when I was watching anime or YouTube videos. It comes with an aux cord but it's different than a standard aux so if you ever lost it you'd have to more than likely go online and order one which was my only complaint. But if you take care of your speaker and don't loose the cord it shouldn't be a problem. It comes with a little cloth bag to put your cords and speaker in which was waaay cool. I did notice the packaging was super simple and easy to open and I could start using my speaker right away! I definitely recommend this if you are on edge of getting this like Nike says....JUST DO IT..lol all jokes aside it's a great speaker I think you would enjoy and I personally would love to try more products from this company in the future

reviews.review_header: Nice sound/size but not quite loud enough.
reviews.review_text: This is a VERY impressive BT speaker that fits in your palm. Better highs and mids than the UE Mini BOOM with the EXACT same amount of BASS which is amazing considering the size difference. It vibrates a lot so putting it on a box makes it act like a bass transducer which further amplifies the bass! Ultimately it's a nice little device but it's too quiet for movies outside of VLC which will always having me looking for something louder. TLDR? Nice size but not loud enough.

reviews.review_header: A great little speaker for a good price, and far more powerful than I anticipated.
reviews.review_text: What comes in the box: - The speaker (measuring just over 1.75 inches) - The Micro USB charging cable - The Micro USB to 3.55mm auxiliary cable - User guide - Carrying bag Anker products are now coming in no hassle packaging. The speaker is boxed in a simple, easy to open cardboard box and there is no cellophane or plastic packaging to deal with. Upon opening, you will find the speaker nested in the box and a smaller box containing the power cord, the auxiliary cable and the carrying bag and the user guide. The speaker comes pre-charged and holds a charge for an ample 12 hours, as advertised. Charging the unit is quick and in my tests, is fully charged in about three hours. Charging is denoted by a red light on the power button and turns off when the speaker is fully charged. When you turn the speaker on, it automatically goes into pair mode to search for a device to pair to or the most recent device that it has connected to. Additionally, the speaker has great sound, and a surprising amount of bass, considering its size. Because of its design, there is no integrated volume control so adjusting the volume of what is being played must be done through the device. The NFC connection works flawlessly and I was able to pair my HTC One M8 easily without a hitch. I was also able to pair older phones easily through the standard pairing function of the devices as well as a couple Bluetooth transmitters that I own for my non Bluetooth Devices. When the speaker is paired with a device, there is an audible ‘beep’ played through the speaker and the power indicator light is a solid blue. While searching for a paired device, the light blinks rapidly and when pairing with a device, the light blinks slower. Because of the design of the unit, you cannot use the provided auxiliary cable while charging (as there is only one Micro USB port on the speaker but charging while connected via Bluetooth has no issues on playback. There is no microphone on this unit so using it as a speakerphone is not really practical. I think that the Anker A7910 is a great little speaker and is something that I would consider buying again as a gift.

reviews.review_header: Small size, great battery life, lacking bass response but overall good
reviews.review_text: I bought this as a gift for my parents, but tried it out before I gave it to them. It's amazingly small and light, and would be a good purchase for people who travel. The battery also seems to last a long time, although I didn't test to see if it gets the full, claimed 12 hours of life. Like all the Anker products I have, it seems well designed and is packaged well (similar to Apple products). It paired easily with several different iPhones and the Bluetooth connection was easy to set up. The package comes with a USB cable, but no wall AC adapter. It also comes with a miniplug to USB cable in case you want to hardwire a connection instead of using Bluetooth (a nice touch). The sound is pretty good, although it is significantly lacking bass compared with other Bluetooth speakers I have and have experienced. It also does not have a mic on it, as some models have, and is lacking a volume control on the unit itself (i.e., you control volume on the source device and not on the speaker itself). All things considered, I would buy it again, mainly because of it's small size and good battery life.

reviews.review_header: Nice small cube speaker, but the sound could be better, not terrible, but just could be better
reviews.review_text: Nice small cube. I love it's looks. It's sound is just okay. NOT as good sound as the Anker SoundCore Nano Bluetooth speaker and they both list for $20 bucks. The Nano has a "richer" sound, this one sounds a bit "tinny" to me. Which surprises me being it's from Anker. Also, this one is bigger than that Nano. But for a twenty dollar bill, this is WAY better than most bluetooth speakers you can find in your local stores, and all of those local speakers cost at least twice as much. And the ones that only cost $20 like this Nano, sound like crap compared to this. Buy this for your kids. Better yet, buy them that Anker SoundCore Nano for the same price. I love Anker products. I have MANY of them. All of them I bought them with my own money. NOTHING was given to me.

reviews.review_header: Much More Than Bargained For/Very Happy with Purchase!
reviews.review_text: I love this "little" speaker, its anything but little really, yes its size is small, but this Anker speaker is kickin'! I bought this Anker speaker about 4 months ago and have been using it almost everyday since! First off I will say, I am a huge backer and buyer of Anker products, they have really nice products from Solar Panel Chargers to Bluetooth Speakers and everything in between, these guys can hook it up (not a paid review, just a big fan). Also they have some of the best customer service I have ever dealt with! Back to my review, I will say this is my most favorite bluetooth speaker I have owned (out of 4). The speaker is very small, lighweight, easy to use, has a 12 hour battery life, 18-month warranty and not to mention somewhat Waterproof! The only reason I say somewhat waterproof is because I took this speaker with me Canoeing, long story short our Canoe flipped and all of my stuff was either lost or completely drenched, the speaker being one that was completely drenched. Now at first the speaker wouldn't work (power on) at all but after leaving it in my car for 3 hours after it had gotten drenched, it managed to dry out, power on and play music again, without any distortion! Now for $20 I am more than happy to have bought this Anker Bluetooth Speaker, it's done more than I bargained for and has made me and others happy with the sound it lets off for such a small speaker! Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and definitely recommend this to anyone in the market to buy one, it would make a great "small" gift! Thanks!

You can't beat this speaker for the price / performance. Pro 1) Super Compact 2) Battery life is amazing, I always play it all day and not have to worry about charging until the next day 3) Bass is extremely good for such a tiny device, just don't have too high of expectation. You have to remember it's very tiny but it definitely can beat the bass of many speakers 2-3 times it's size. 4) Bluetooth connection and the voice alerts are very useful 5) Battery charges very fast 6) Low price Con It would be nice to have an Aux connection into this speaker I own many bluetooth speakers (over 40) but this one and the Bose SoundLink Mini are definitely my 2 favorite speakers. The latter one is obviously much much more expensive.

reviews.review_header: Anker support is amazing! High pitched whining noise is a problem not with the model, but that specific speaker. Get it replaced
reviews.review_text: When I first got this product, it was defective. While I liked the size, battery life, and how loud this speaker can be, it had a very high-pitched whining noise that was prevalent whenever sound was coming out of the speakers. I thought it was not a defect but a product flaw due to a review on amazon that stated that he has gotten an replacement and the problem was prevalent so I ignored it as a flaw in the model in general, not my specific speaker. Few days later, I received an email from Anker asking me whether I was satisfied with the product. I asked when whether the whining sound was a problem with the model or my speaker. They said it was my speaker. Since they paid for return shipping I decided to just try getting a replacement, despite that review. After I got my replacement, it was perfect. No more high-pitched noise. Product has nice matte texture and a rubber non-slip base. While it's a shame that it cannot be charged and play through a 3.5mm aux cable at the same time, I think wireless playback still works while charging. It's half the size of my fist and yet can match normal desktop speakers in volume. The battery life is great. I've used it for a full day as my desktop speakers and did not have to charge it. I'm not an audiophile so I cannot comment on sound quality, but it's very crisp. No distortions or whatsoever even with a wireless bluetooth connection over ~4 feet.

reviews.review_header: and it can easily be heard in my car even with open windows
reviews.review_text: Even after reading the very positive reviews, I didn't anticipate that this "pocket size" speaker would be as remarkable as it is. As other reviewers have commented, the sound is rich, and it can easily be heard in my car even with open windows; that wasn't true with my last portable speaker, which was more than twice the size of this one. I was immediately struck by its design and quality. It's solid, with excellent fit and finish - it feels "right", the product of putting quality before profits. And, really, what I like most is just the unlikeliness of its existence; a cube, each side about as wide as three and a half sugar cubes, and yet it's so much more than a toy. I don't write many reviews, but obviously the Anker inspired me to let people know what they'd be getting.

reviews.review_header: Nice little speaker for a handheld radio scanner
reviews.review_text: I really like Anker products. I saw this on a scanner webpage and bought it to use with my BCD426HP which has kind of low audio level. I can't hear it in the car. This speaker is a lot smaller than I was expecting. It works really nice. I have a little Zio bluetooth transmitter so I can this as bluetooth input or direct with the AUX. I am not sure it is going to have enough audio power to work in the car as I hope. I want to be able to listen to my podcasts at a decent level and have the scanner come up as loud or louder than my stereo. I can locate the little speaker near my ear or somewhere where where it has an advantage. I will have to just see. but it is louder than the scanner and sounds really good. Even if it isn't big enough for my car needs, I know I will find a use for it.

EXCELLENT little speakers, they are actually pretty loud, There is a reviewer that made a video about them, You can watch his video his, does it justice regarding it's sound, The quality is really good, and the loudness of the sound is control by whatever it's connectd to, fors instant if you have it connected to your computer then it's the computer volume settings that controls it. Oh I also connected to my android phone it tends to be louder on my phone then in my computer I think the computer has slightly different setting for volume safety but my android galaxy phone does sound a bit louder, but don't let that be a deterrent, The sound with a computer or any other device is quiet strong, I show it to my mother playing music that she likes and call her in my room to have her hear but I didn't show her the speaker, and when I told her she was amaze at the sound, loudness of it, also this tiny speaker packs sound bass you would not think something so small would have bass a noticeble lever, I can actually feel the bass from, So in fact do buy this speakers are great for music and a computer which is what I used them for, I don't think anyone will be disappointing with its performance unless you get a lemon. Oh while connecting to the computer it gave me a bit of trouble, It didn't work the first time so I had to erase the device from the Bluetooth setting and reinstall it again. So this little speaker will not disappoint you or who ever you buy them for.,

Amazing sound from a small speaker! This Anker speaker is amazing. The sound quality it produces is just incredible for its size. Everything about this speaker is quality. From its packaging to the product itself. For $23 your really getting a quality product. The materials this little speaker is made from feel and look great. The whole bottom of the speaker is rubber so it won't slide around while in use. As for the sound quality, when you first get it you'll be expecting a decent performing little speaker. Something that sounds a little better then the built in speaker on your smartphone. However once you pair it with your phone you will be impressed with it. It sounds much bigger then it is. The sound is clear and well balanced. It reproduces highs and mids very well. However it does have a little trouble with lows and bass. But that's to be expected. You can certainly hear the lower freqencys but its obviously not going to be like a stand alone sub. But again for a speaker this small it produces very acceptable levels of bass and low frequencys. If I had to compare the sound quality of this device I'd say its similar to that of a mid level portable sterio or small boom box. The battery life is very good. Its able to get through an 8 hour work day with plenty of charge left. Inusualy leave mine at 75% volume. This speaker is loud enough to play in a busy shop. Its also loud enough to fill a large room! Its obviously not a good choice for playing over a croud but a small get together shouldn't be an issue. I'm going to leave this speaker at work since it easily fits in my draw. I also ordered the larger version to keep at home. I think I might have found my new favorite Bluetooth speaker company! Usually small speakers like this, at this price point are cheaply made and have only decent sound. But this thing blew me away in every aspect. I'm looking forward to recieveing the bigger version soon. I should also add that the device you pair it with will have an effect on the sound quality you get. For example my LG G3 is able to play this speaker at loud levels but I feel as if my phone can't let this speaker acheave its full capabilities. My Lenovo PAD S8-50 on the other hand really brings out the full potential of this product. So I guess the sound quality of this speaker is affected by the product you pair it with.

reviews.review_header: The sound is much better from this compared to any phones or tablets
reviews.review_text: Size is deceiving! The sound is much better from this compared to any phones or tablets. It is clear and loud. My mother watches cooking shows and K-dramas on a Galaxy Tab S2 while cooking. She says she can now hear every word from all of her shows even with a smoke fan on, or with water running, etc... The battery life seems great - it hasn't been killed yet. One thing I will mention though is that the device it is paired with is best kept within line of sight of the cube. If you pair it with a phone, put the phone in your pocket, and then walk around the room, depending on obstructions between the cube and your phone, the connection becomes inconsistent. But within line of sight, the connection is good for about 10-15 meters (depending on the device). I am probably going to buy one for myself. Another plus - the packaging is nice, and it comes with a micro-usb to aux cable (for a direct connection), along with a little baggy to keep the cube safe if you travel around with it.

My family and I compared side to side these bluetooth portable speakers, all of which have high ratings in Amazon. These are our opinions. = Anker Pocket Ultra Portable (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00OEPCHL2/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0) Pros: Highest surprise factor, given its loudness to size. Very petite and extremely portable Lowest price of all 5 NFC Cons: Some sound distorsion Summary: Excelent personal speaker. very easy to carry. It was my teen daughters favorite. = EasyAcc® Music Cube Bluetooth Speaker (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KS41MWS/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1) Pros: Well balanced sound Answering microphone Remote control of music player Long battery life (we didn't test it) Cons: The least loud of the 5 Sound lack depth Too bulky for its loudness Summary: Nice if you tend to stay hours in the same place, listening to music while answering calls = Bolse® 5W Portable Mini Bluetooth v4.0 Wireless (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00M7D93Q0/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2) Pros Second best sounding Great looks Cons Given its size and its 5W label, not loud enough Controls hidden on bottom Summary: Good speaker, but not exceptional in any sense = 808 CANZ Bluetooth Wireless Speaker (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00EFS0ZK8/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_3) Pros: Surprising loudness. The loudest of all 5 Strong bass Cons: Sound is 3rd best of the 5, but its not realy balanced Summary Given its loudness, it is the best for outdors, or a small party = JBL Clip Portable Bluetooth Speaker With Mic (http://www.amazon.com/JBL-Clip-Portable-Bluetooth-Black/dp/B00KH636V2/ref=pd_sim_e_4?ie=UTF8&refRID=0T928ZB0H3RY9WNM2GYK) Pros Very loud, only second to CANZ Best overall sound Given its shape and materials, it is designed to be portable Cons: None Summary: The Anker is lovely and surprisng, the CANZ is loud and surprising, but the JBL is the overall best speaker of the lot. You can't go wrong with the JBL

reviews.review_header: Haha, that speaker is tiny! ... OMG, that's amazing!!
reviews.review_text: You wouldn't think that something so small could produce sound so loud! It's not only loud, but it is also pretty crisp. Of course, since it has a passive sub-woofer, you're not going to get amazing sounding bass, but it's there. If you listen to music that isn't reliant on a strong bass presence, I think you will enjoy this speaker. For the people who can't listen to songs without bass, I played Stevie Wonder's Superstition and it sounded great. (I had to lower the quality of the video to fit 100MB... Also, as I was making the video, I realized I don't have that many songs that are "bass-heavy" haha..) - I had trouble uploading the video to Amazon (come on, seriously??) so I uploaded onto YouTube instead - http://youtu.be/IB8XQ1mSh28 It's extremely easy to carry around. You can put it in the provided cloth pouch (which is pretty nice), along with the two included cables (microUSB charging and microUSB-AUX) in the same pouch, and carry it around in the size of a men's cargo pants side-leg pocket. Of course, it would be even easier for women to carry around in a purse too. All of that said, for something at this size and for this quality, you can't go around with ~$22-25. You're not spending over $60, so you wouldn't be disappointed by the sound it puts out for the cost. Rather, you would be happy that spending less than $25, you're getting a Bluetooth/AUX/NFC super-portable speaker that puts out sound quality that could equal or best some more costly ones! I am giving it 5 stars, not because it is the best speaker out there, but because the cost is low and the quality is high. Granted, I haven't had it for more than a month yet, but it feels solidly built. I'll have to update once it passes a few months!

I've used Amazon for years but this is the first time to review, because I was so impressed with this device. I enjoy listening to podcasts in the car, but unfortunately it's an older model. No Bluetooth connectivity, no auxiliary ports. Not even a tape player. My only real options were earphones (not safe), fm transmitters (spotty signals), or a portable speaker. I've been genuinely impressed by this product and couldn't be more pleased with the purchase. It's inexpensive, so I wouldn't be upset if it was lost or stolen. It's small, and can be tossed in the glovebox when not in use. It's surprisingly loud, more than adequate for the car on a noisy highway, and the audio quality is very clear for dialogs. I don't use it for music but it would be sufficient for casual use. The device itself has a very nice, solid finish, and comes with charging cords, audio jack and felt bag for storage. The battery lasts quite a long time and charging is quick. And it does have a Bluetooth capability if you'd rather go cordless. Thanks again for making such an excellent product.

I have been using the Achor mini for my ipad 3 as I feel the Ipad doesnt have very good speakers. The products is able to connect with my devices with bluetooth and the chord connection. The only problem I find is when I tried connecting the bluetooth with my cell phone- Nokia Lumia 635.It does not show the visibility of the Anchor in the Lumia Phone bluetooth network. I guess its the problem experienced with Nokia Lumia Phones. But then this problem can be solved via the chords. I have other portable and mini speaker devices as well but none had the bluetooth option, it always had to be connected via the chord. The bluetooth gives you the flexibility to place the speaker anywhere you which and hence giving an awesome effect. Also unlike other Chinese made mini speakers, when tested in high volume, it doesnt screech and the voice also doesnt break. You will be amazed the clear sound that is produced from this mini speaker device. I enjoy using the device while taking a shower. Dont try placing the device in the shower as it is not water proof. Well I am happy with the overall utility as have been using it on a daily basis. Also I am very happy about the pocket size. This is the first time I have used Anchor and very happy. Looking forward for some new Anchor products - achor portable charger

reviews.review_header: Initially loved it: But it was a 6 month stand.
reviews.review_text: The speaker on my Macbook Pro is blown. This is after replacing a bad logic board for $$$$ and this was my inexpensive solution to the new problem. This speaker works great! It sounds ten times ( subjective measurement) better than the laptop speaker ever did. It is small enough to fit in the pocket of the laptop sleeve with the duck taped apple power cord that is cord # 3. Battery life seems eternal and connected in 1 second via blue tooth. Comes with RCA 3.5mm cable if you don't have or want to use blue tooth and charger cord and a small well constructed pouch. It's not Bose sound but it's perfect for portability,battery life and sound quality is surprisingly good. Mending my review: Spontaneously died and now won't turn on. Less than 1 year life. No trauma to speaker as far as I know on my part--just fizzled out. Editing my amendment: Anker read my comment and then sent me a new speaker. I was really happy about that., They did it with no effort on my part other than reading my review. I have to say, that is a wonderful way to do business. The new speaker works as advertised. Has replaced the blown MacBook Pro speaker. Now if only Apple would acknowledge their chargers, logic boards and speakers don't hold up on a certain series of MacBook Pros Anyways thank you Anker, good sounding speaker, long battery life, very portable, connects via bluetooth in a second, comes with a second cable to hook up directly without bluetooth, and priced right!

reviews.review_header: Powerful punch for its small size.
reviews.review_text: You shouldn't expect amazing sound from this little guy, but neither should you underestimate it. Inside Anker's elegant but simplistic packaging you will find everything necessary to get you started, including usb cables and a nice microfiber faux velvet travel pouch. I found max volume to be less than I would have wished with some minor distortion in the upper bounds, but sound quality is very good for this speaker class. It will most likely exceed most user expectations and may even surprise a few audiophiles. Battery life is excellent as advertised, and pairing with NFC was a breeze. Hope it will last like other Anker products. One side note. I tried setting this on my bathroom counter top to listen to while in the shower. Unfortunately, the volume isn't quiet loud enough to pierce the sound of running water even when just 3 feet away. Also for comparison the Anker A7910 seems to exceed sound quality of AmazonBasics A100s in some ways, though not quite as loud at max volume. It has clearer, less muddled mids and highs, though bass falls flat for both speakers (but that's expected considering the speaker class).

reviews.review_header: Small speakers with high volume output but has some significant drawbacks.
reviews.review_text: Dec 01, 2015: Update - I changed the rating from 3 to 4 stars purely for the fantastic customer service. After posting my review I got an email and I was offered a replacement with the bigger but more fully featured A7908 bluetooth speaker. Pros: Very loud speaker from such a small form factor. I haven't used the NFC feature yet, but like having it available when needed. Cons: There are no volume or skip controls on this speaker. The only button is for the Power on/off. The LED indicator is on the button you are pressing so it is difficult to see it. It does not have a microphone, so using it more than a few feet away from the device it is paired to will not be very effective. Also, you can't use it effectively for phone calls - since it has no microphone and controls to answer or hang up the call. When I used this speaker with IPad connected with the audio jack the volume was very loud and clear, but when I did the same with an Android device and Skype the volume was very low - even though I had set the volume in the device to the highest.

reviews.review_header: I heard good things from the people i bought them for...
reviews.review_text: These were bought as presents for kids and these kids to be VERY verbal when something doesn't work correctly so it's safe to say they enjoyed them quite well. Their father commented that, for their size, it was a pleasant surprise how well they worked.

reviews.review_header: Is that an Anker bluetooth speaker in your pocket, or are you just glad to see me?
reviews.review_text: My goodness Anker, can you do no wrong? I think this is my 5th Anker product - three batteries and now two speakers, and I couldn't be more impressed with the build quality and functionality of them. Based on appearance alone, this little speaker should sound muffled, tinny and lacking of bass like most of the other teeny speakers out there, but it doesn't! I used it for the first time in the kitchen last night, and my 12-year-old daughter asked if I was using my UE Mini Boom - another small speaker with great sound. This Anker is half the size of that UE! I can't honestly say it sounds as good, but I'll say it's 80-90% of UE, falling just a little short in the bass department. That being said, I can literally fit this Anker in the pocket of my jeans, and It has plenty of sound to fill up a small to medium sized room. It has nice clean lines - there is no volume control, just a single button that functions as both the on/off and pairing switch, and the bottom is rubberized to keep this little gem in place. While I am not an Anker spokesperson (nor someone who gets their products for free) I can't say enough good things about this speaker (and the other four Anker items I own.

This little 1.5" cube of a bluetooth speaker is an AWESOME DEAL!! First off, the sound is good enough to play jazz (REAL jazz..Not "smooth jazz" which isn't jazz at all, but I digress!) loud enough to fill up a 35'X25' room. I know this, because that's what this speaker does for me every work day. It's a little weak on the bass, but that's fine; especially for the price you're paying for such a good output. No, you're not going to blow the windows out with this little baby; but it provides great, clear background music for a large room. Secondly, the charge holds up for a very good, long time. I come to work every day at 8:30 a.m (after leaving it charged overnight), and it plays perfectly until I leave work at 3:45. At the end of each workday, I just plug it into a "charging" computer that's always on here at work, and leave it alone overnight. The computer is ..hold up...Let me see how far I can take this laptop away before it starts skipping..EXPERIMENTING RIGHT NOW.....Holy crap! I just went across the room, 35 feet away, and nothing changed! I even put it behind a partition, and it just kept belting out Miles Davis!! This is awesome! Search no further. Ok, maybe you want to spend 10 bucks more to get free shipping. Well don't spend it on a speaker; go spend it on something else, because this little baby is awesome. Back to listening to Dexter Gordon now. There's no

reviews.review_header: Very useful small wireless Bluetooth speaker.
reviews.review_text: I can say I'm very pleased about this small Bluetooth speaker. It easily connects with my iPod nano where I control the volume with the ipod in my pocket. I used it everytime I go for volunteer work and my friends are just amazed how this little speaker can produce a loud enough solid sound. I put a Velcro on the back and attached it to wall in my bed overhead to listen to relaxing and meditation music. The battery last longer than my iPod 4 hrs. vs. 12 hours that I only charge it once a week.

I ordered this product to take backpacking and was attracted by the compact size and low weight of the item. When my first Anker Pocket Size speaker arrived I turned it on and could hear that the speaker was defective. Normally I would return the defective item and order something different. However, I really liked the simplistic and functional design of this speaker and I knew Anker produced quality products so I decided to try a second one. The Amazon replacement process was easy and fast. My new speaker arrived and worked perfectly. The sound is large for the size and no, you wont feel any thumping bass but the audio is far better than any tablet or phone speaker, and it is almost as loud as my other slightly larger Bluetooth speakers. The long battery life is another plus. I have an Anker recharge battery which I have been using for a couple years now and that is also a quality product. Most defective electronic products are not worth a second chance but I am very pleased with this speaker and am glad I gave it another shot. Order one, you wont be dissapointed.

reviews.review_header: I LOVE music and could no longer tolerate the canned sound ...
reviews.review_text: This little thing is the bomb! Small, but powerful. I'm using it in my office at work on my desk that has very little available real estate. I LOVE music and could no longer tolerate the canned sound coming directly from my built-in laptop speaker. Just what I needed :-)

This little guy puts out excellent sound. It even has reasonable bass, much more than one expects for its size. The volume of sound is room filling, and can be heard in other rooms of the house if the doors are open. You won't be disappointed unless you are expecting Bose performance for the price. There is one tiny issue. If you place the speaker right next to your device's bluetooth antenna, the BT connection will cut in and out rapidly. The issue may also vary with the volume. Solution, move it six inches away. I returned the first one I received because of the issue. However, the second one also did it. But if I move the speaker to the other end of my 8.4" tablet, there is no problem. I kept the second one because the issue is trivial and it's the best speaker of that size - very portable.

The audio quality wasn't as good as I thought. My phone's stereo had better quality while this one had distorted sound on it. I'm using EQ if that's what causing it but my bluetooth car and my bluetooth headset don't have distorted sound on them so I guess this is not as good. I didn't return it because I threw the box already hoping it would come as what I'd hope. UPDATE: They sent me a new replacement and it was actually better than I thought! the distortion was gone and the quality is really good. I'm glad I got a replacement because I really liked how small this is and the battery life is really long. Thank you for taking the time sending me a replacement. I appreciate!

Bought this speaker expecting an OK speaker, nice-ish quality, but nothing too fancy. This product exceeded expectations, and I use it all the time. Of course, this isn't professional grade sound quality, but for $20, you're getting a heck of a nice speaker. Good support on all frequency ranges, incredibly powerful for its size. It's better than my car's stereo system, so I put some velcro on my dash and on the bottom, and is very loud and clear, even over the noise of the engine. Overall, better than those weird pill speakers, has a great battery life, very small and portable, and packs a surprising punch. 9/10, just because larger more expensive speakers technically sound better.

It's not your surround sound home theater, but it's perfect for a little ambiance while sitting in a rocking chair on the back patio. My (grown) kids like to play "name that tune" while playing poker or other board games and this little speaker allows for a little music without turning up the stereo indoors or draining the battery on a smart phone.
