It also has a minimal footprint (and no power requirement) so it's totally flexible as to where you can put it. It was easy to charge, and link with a little transmitter inserted in my (indoor) tuner's earphone jack. A 20 foot range (through walls and doors) was no problem. I can't yet attest to battery life, but the mere size of the unit makes me think it doesn't really require much power - ergo longer life. Bottom line, I'm totally satisfied with the purchase.

I've only had this for a short while, so if anything changes I'll come back and report. But as is, this is an excellent little device for my needs. I have gone through far too many bluetooth speakers over the years. They die too soon, or won't connect with the device I bought them for, or stop charging sufficiently. I bought this for an aging Nexus 7 (2012). The cheap audio battery in Nexus failed early on. Because I otherwise like it, I've tried various devices to boost the audio volume ever since. This particular Anker wireless bluetooth is the best solution I've found so far. No trouble pairing, quite loud enough for my purposes, easy to carry, easy to charge and utterly simple. I buy a lot of Anker products, as do so many other people, for the best reasons any consumer ever has. They tend to work more reliably, last longer, cost less, and come with the best customer service around. And no, nobody paid me to write this.

I love this little box!!! It charges so quickly, to last so long. I love how when you hold it in your hand, you can feel tiny little thumps, during songs with adequate bass. I enjoy the fact that it always finds my phone and I never have to reconnect, upon connecting under Bluetooth for the 1st time (I have a Galaxy Note 3). I love the durable design. It really knows how to fill a room with sound. The wonderful thing about this tiny speaker is you don't really need to know a whole lot about acoustics, in order to get a huge amount of sound out if her. For example, I primarily use this in my vehicle, so i find that by placing it into a cup holder, the sound comes across as being more of a rich, heavenly sound. I have also linked this to the Audio port of my HDTV and have found that it is actually a better external speaker than my actual television. I don't need a Sound Bar, this little guy really fills the room for me and at a MUCH better price. If I am being completely honest though, my 0nly Gripe is that the max volume of this thing is limited to your device. I suppose this is some kind of fail-safe, so as not to blow out your tiny little speaker. So, okay...

reviews.review_header: I sometimes like to watch a movie on my iPad in my ...
reviews.review_text: WOW! What power from a TINY little box! When you first hold the button to just turn it on the tone it makes is rich sounding. I sometimes like to watch a movie on my iPad in my craft room where there's a wall air conditioning unit. It's a little loud. You can't hear the iPad well. The cube is more than adequate with the outside noise. AND, I enjoy having my Amazon music stream when I'm working here and there and the sound from the little cube is so much better than an iPad's sound. I was just seeing how well I'd like one of these after first learning about them so I bought an inexpensive one. There's no need to buy a bigger better one in my world so I'm happy with this one. It's easy to charge too.

reviews.review_header: Great sound, amazing battery life and so tiny
reviews.review_text: I had previously ordered a shark small speaker. The shark was great and had amazing sound but I dropped it (not very far) and the charger port fell into the case. After trying in vain to crack the thing open and repair it I finally gave up. I didn't like the idea of ordering another shark after the small drop had wrecked the last one so after doing some research I ordered the Anker ultra portable. I love this speaker. The sound is at least as clear as the shark and I think it gets louder. I think the shark had a little better deep base sound but the Anker seems to be overall a better speaker. The battery life on the Anker is amazing and I love that's it's lighter and a little smaller than th shark. I pair this speaker with a Brookstone mini digital projector and I can set up an amazing movie night anywhere there's a wall and a dim room. I no longer have a tv I just use the same projector and Anker speaker as my home TV as well. It's 120 inch screen that goes in a drawer when I'm done watching. The blue tooth is so much easier to pair with my iPad than the shark was. Overall I couldn't be happier with this Anker speaker.

reviews.review_header: both podcasts and music sound great. Guests are always amazed that all of that ...
reviews.review_text: I adore this. I use this tiny speaker every day while I'm cooking and cleaning in my kitchen. It stays charged forever (I have yet to have it die on me - I plug it for a while maybe once a week) and the sound! The sound for a device this size and this price is impressive, both podcasts and music sound great. Guests are always amazed that all of that sound is coming from that little box. Also, I really appreciated all of the attention to detail in packaging the item. I wish I had taken pictures but opening it was a lot like opening a present, and there were some great little details inside the box. I'm thrilled with this purchase and will look into more items from Anker in the future.

Because of the many glowing reviews I incorrectly assumed that this little speaker sounded absolutely wonderful. Yes, it sounds much, much better than the speakers on my smart phone(s) and tablet(s). However, the speaker simply has no bass. Yes, it gets pretty loud - considering its diminutive size, but its only good for say a an office cubicle where you don't want to bother your co-workers. I use it primary when viewing movies on my tablet, but when working outside I prefer my JBL Charge speaker. Yes, I know - there is a huge difference in size between the two. Its like comparing apples to oranges, but again the Anker speaker fills a purpose too. It is not intended to fill a room with your favorite Smiths song.

Great little speaker with good volume when used in a small room (bedroom or bathroom) (I haven't used it elsewhere). The only thing I would improve is the little power light which I can't tell is on or off so that I have sometimes left the speaker on all day, thinking I had turned it off. And although there is a message that tells you when the power is low (and thus the speaker needs to be recharged) it comes on only a few minutes before the entire speaker dies, so not conducive to planning to charge the speaker before you plan to use it for an extended time. But it is a good buy and I would purchase it again.

reviews.review_header: Great compact size, exceptional battery life, good volume
reviews.review_text: I bought this while I had a traveling job and I wanted a small bluetooth speaker that I could take in my carry on bag without taking up much room. This has worked perfectly for that, all while sounding about as well as you can expect from something this small. This speaker will get as loud as you would reasonably need it, all while providing clear sound. I use this mainly for connecting to my tablet but it has no trouble connecting to my phone, or laptop. The battery life of this speaker is impressive and often outlasts whatever I have connected to it when watching youtube videos. It comes with a nice little microfiber drawstring bag and the speaker itself has that nice matte soft rubber feel to it. It also has sound prompts when pairing, turning on, turning off, and running low on battery.

Great little speaker with a long battery life. A few comments: - Cannot use it while charging. - Does not have a volume switch so if your device's lowest volume setting is too loud, you cannot turn it any lower. - The LED is lit blue when connected via bluetooth. If you connect it to a device using an AUX cable, the LED is off, making it easy to forget it is on and to turn if off when not in use. I think these three things are very minor and will not affect most users, just a few things to be aware of so you are not surprised. I use it to listen to streaming radio and podcasts. For this kind of use, the small size does not affect the audio quality. Really like this little speaker. Also, I sent them an email asking about the LED and they got back withing the day and were extremely helpful. 5 stars to their tech support and customer follow-up!

This TINY bluetooth speaker reeks of QUALITY. My review title is the antithesis of what I'd like to say. It is a top notch product from Anker as expected and DELIVERS a crisp, clean balanced sound. It is a PERSONAL speaker, not designed to "fill a room" with music but, placed on your desk or nightstand it has plenty of punch. With just 2 controls it is also very SIMPLE to use. There is a micro USB input for charging AND aux input and the ON/OFF button which is also the blue light indicating pairing or operating. Build quality is SOLID, unlike many small speakers. It does ONE thing extremely well: reproduce music or voice with integrity. I use mine on the bedside table for late night podcasts and soothing music. It's about the size of an egg. Volume is controlled completely from your device which I find convenient. I may buy a second one just for the office desk. Its' footprint is just a couple of inches so NOT an intrusion at all. For about $20 you will NOT be sorry!

For the price, It's a pretty good speaker. Light, compact, the battery lasts a very long time. The audio quality is exceptional for it's size, it throws a pretty good bump for EDM and rock. Sounds better when on a hard surface, such as a table. It's very good for nights on the patio, conversing or having a smoke session. I would rate it 5 stars, but I only had the device for about 3 weeks before something went wrong. Only one of the speakers inside works unless you press down on the input cord. Not sure how long before it dies completely, but it seems like it will soon. So, $20 sort of wasted. If this is your first Anker product, and something goes wrong with it, I would say give it another chance. I might buy a more high end speaker from them to see if Anker is a company worth buying from again. If not, then it's back to JBL, Jambox, or something of the sort.

reviews.review_header: BUT this little baby is fantastic. I love the fact that is has bluetooth ...
reviews.review_text: This replaces my "cube" which stopped charging after about five years of service. BUT this little baby is fantastic. I love the fact that is has bluetooth so my iphone doesn't have to be tied to it when playing like my old cube. I can use my phone and when I do it mutes the music and sends the sound to the cube and I can walk around with my phone in my pocket and still have music playing. It took me about 30 seconds to pair after following the simple instructions. It has only one button which lights up and does everything it needs to. The rest is taken care of by your smart phone. It is simple, basic and has great sound. It is perfect for traveling and one of my best buys.

reviews.review_header: I was super surprised when I first opened this package and actually ...
reviews.review_text: I was super surprised when I first opened this package and actually witnessed how small this speaker is. It first perfectly in the palm of my hands. I was further surprised when it produced a sound that I couldn't believe was coming out of such a small speaker. I had to move the speaker away from me because it was so loud! I normally keep the volume halfway - and that enough is loud enough to fill up a room or two, as well as be heard very clearly over running water when I shower or wash my face in the morning! It comes with a little velvet bag, which is great for transportation and protection! Great buy, no regrets.

reviews.review_header: Could have been a great speaker
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, this bluetooth speaker did not quite meet my expectations in terms of sound quality based on the high number of positive ratings. When listening at low to moderate volume levels, a static/buzzing noise can easily be heard in a setting such as a small room. This noise is especially accentuated when there are quiet moments in a song. If you are listening more than a few feet away and at a high enough volume (> than about 30% volume) the static noise is not noticable.This speaker was tested with an iphone, and an ipad with the same issue. Anker customer support was extremely helpful in assisting with a replacement, but to my surprise, the second speaker had the exact same problem, leading me to believe that there may be an issue with quality control on Anker's side. I ended up returning the replacement for a full refund. Pros -very well packaged -great build quality -very portable -NFC (for devices that have this) -can get very loud without much distortion -matte texture repels fingerprints -great battery life -exceptional customer service -comes with all cables you need/is ready right out of the box Cons -no microphone -cannot use in line connection and charge at the same time (slightly negated by great battery life) -static/buzzing noise at moderate volume Had it not been for the static noise I would have kept this speaker. However for my needs it was not sufficient. I give this speaker a hesitant recommendation. If you will be in close proximity to the speaker and will only be listening at a low to moderate volume, such as in a bedroom setting, I would suggest searching a little more first. However, If you will be more than a few feet away and have the volume turned up, I would have no qualms about recommending you this speaker as you should not be in range to hear the static noise.

reviews.review_header: Good for its size and price
reviews.review_text: Surprisingly good performance for a small size and price. For me this is best used for travel as an external speaker for my iPhone -- lightness is important. I mostly listen to talk. A little tinny and hollow sounding, and as you might expect in such as small speaker, little base. Frankly, it is not a lot better than the speaker in my iPhone 5S, but it can get much louder and is better enough to use. It has a much less natural sound compared to the Oontz Curve, which is about twice the size and heavier. I returned the Oontz Curve, however, because it is talking ALL the time, when connecting, etc. The Anker speaker just beeps (thank you). I'll keep this little speaker for travel, but for home use I am going to try one of the larger Anker bluetooth speakers.

reviews.review_header: This Thing Isn't Just Good, It's Perfect!
reviews.review_text: This speaker, this tiny little speaker... This thing absolutely blows me away. I use this with an iPhone 6 plus. When somewhat near the phone, there is very little audio delay to the visuals. The Bluetooth speed is incredible! It also pairs with my phone instantly as soon as I turn it on. And this little thing is LOUD. To give some perspective, my mom was watching TV in the other room, fairly loudly, loud enough that I could hear it 35 feet away in the other room and the dishwasher was running. I had the speaker on listening to the Reds game at 4 notches below full volume. I walked to the room where my mom was watching TV and I could still clearly hear my speaker. This little guy is incredible. The sound is very good quality. There is even a pretty solid (for the size) bass presence. I think there might be a tiny little woofer in this thing. Trebles are clear too. And for only $20?! This speaker is perfect. Anker is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_header: Impressive Engineering But Limited Frequency Response
reviews.review_text: This tiny speaker is a pretty good buy as long as you're not expecting miracles. The reproduction of low frequencies requires the movement of air and a speaker this small simply cannot get the job done. The sound is clear and highs are fine, as is volume, but, not surprisingly, there is essentially no low end. The unit appears to be well made and, as an exercise in the limits of technology, is a impressive achievement. I can imagine putting this little guy in my backpack, along with my iPod Nano (an equally impressive achievement in miniaturization), and being able to play tunes in the tent. Very handy but, for truly decent sound with music, I'd recommend a larger speaker.

reviews.review_header: Excelent for its size: Sounds strong enough and is very portable.
reviews.review_text: Even though I have no previous experiences that can let explain how good this speaker is in relation to similar devices available in the market, I can express that I am very satisfied about this device. I was searching for a portable and nice looking speaker with good sound and quality, which could be transported in my waist bag in order to improve my mobile phone. I’ve got what I was looking for and it has also remarkable battery autonomy. It sounds very good for its tiny size. Of course, you should not expect to have an amazing and rocking strong sound, but you will be able to improve greatly the original sound of your mobile or tablet. This speaker exceeded my expectations. I love it!

reviews.review_header: Simple to use, quality sound & construction, reliable performance, extremely long battery life
reviews.review_text: This little speaker is PERFECT for what I needed! If you're looking for a very small portable speaker with an extremely long battery life and great sound, look no further! First I want to say the packaging for this was delightful, very well-designed. The speaker itself also feels very well-made with a nice heft to it (but not heavy) and the travel bag it comes with is great. This is a VERY simple speaker--- no schmancy bells and whistles-- you control the sound through your phone (or whatever device you're playing music from), you can't change any levels or program anything into it or use voice control or whatever--- but I didn't need or want anything like that and I greatly appreciate the simplicity, quality sound, reliable performance, and extremely long battery life of this speaker. It connected to my phone with no problem and always automatically connects with no problems. When you turn it on and off it has a very nice chime sound (no horrible loud voice). Love it!!!!

reviews.review_header: Fantastic little speaker for the road warrior
reviews.review_text: I travel most weeks for work. This is a fantastic little speaker for it's size. I use it to stream NPR news in the morning while I'm showering and shaving in the hot and steamy shower room, protecting my iPhone from the steam (which will ruin an iPhone). It gets plenty loud for hotel use, which tend to be pretty quiet places. Also stream Pandora. It's not going to put out much bass, the physics just don't support it. With that expectation aside, it's great. Took it to the beach, and it was nice to stream some Dave Mathews for ambiance. In my 22" carry on, it fits in a shoe, which is GREAT. And it's three ounces. For what it can do within it's physical design constraints, it's a winner. Money well spent. All in all, I'm very happy. If this information is helpful, please like this review.

Awesome little pocket powerhouse. After reading many reviews on Amazon I finally settled on this Anker ultra portable pocket size wireless Bluetooth speaker. It came out well packaged with all the necessary instructions. Very simple to use. Bluetooth pairing was very simple and easy to follow. Connected instantly with my Android phone as well as my iPad air. This little speaker packs a lot of power and it's loud and can be incredibly high for a medium sized room. Absolute value for the money. I would not compare this speaker to some of the high end speakers such as the JBLs and the Bose speaker. This speaker guarantees you the maximum bang for the buck. You cannot get better than this for the sub $25.00 Bluetooth speaker. The bass is very clear without any distortion even at the highest volume. The treble might be a little less if you are a lover of those pin drop sounds. The speaker is so tiny that it easily fits in a pocket or the palm of your hand. Overall a very good buy and a quality product from Anker.

reviews.review_header: Huge surprise from a tiny box
reviews.review_text: Opening the box I never expected the speaker to be soo tiny but the output blew my mind. It was bought as a gift for my Mom as she likes to watch Netflix on her IPad and complains when my Dad has the TV too loud she can't hear whatever she's watching. The first day she got it, she blew the TV volume out of the water forcing my dad to watch what ever she was. This was a perfect purchase and even at the highest volume level, the clarity is phenomenal.

reviews.review_header: Outstanding speaker, really good for voice and speech output
reviews.review_text: I use this to listen to podcasts while I putter around the house, and it works fantastic. I don't even have to turn the volume up that much, when it's at full volume I can hear it clearly from another room. Works okay for music but obviously there isn't a big bass boom because of its small size. It's absolutely perfect for travel when I want to listen to something in my hotel room. Comes with a small soft bag. Even the sides of the speaker are some futuristic material that feels metallic and soft at the same time. Am totally satisfied, great product. Seems to me that this speaker even has a cleaner, crisper sound (for voice) than my display audio, which is pretty decent itself. This is my 2nd Anker product and I am very impressed with their products.

I was kind of disappointed. I love Anker products, and in many ways this box is impreesive because it looks cool, really well designed, and is very small. Also solid and not at all cheap feeling. I was just a little let down by the sound. I am an audio engineer, so don't get me wrong, I wasn't expecting a miracle in a tiny box (or any bass, but that's not what I got it for) but I was expecting more clarity from the midrange, and a slightly better performance at louder volumes. Believe it or not, my recommendation for the best inexpensive portable speaker for travel (such as hotel rooms etc..) is the AmazonBasics Mini (and not the Nano, which is the small round one). The mini is bigger than this one of course, but still small and packs a decent punch across all frequencies for the price.

We've been using this tiny speaker for three months and it works perfectly! Points in its favor: *a really crisp sound *extremely light and portable *hearty...my son has accidentally dropped it off his bunk bed several times onto a hard floor *strong signal *long charge life (just be sure to leave it charging for a long time) *does not loudly announce changes like our orger device (which can be jarring when my kids listen as they fall asleep) I would absolutely buy it again.

reviews.review_header: Definitely worthy of attention, good value, and fair sound quality.
reviews.review_text: This is a teeny tiny little speaker which I find useful, easily portable, and with a relatively decent sound quality. It is easy to charge, easy to pair, easy to transport. And while we can't expect a crystal clear or rich sound coming out of such a tiny, and economical, package, the sound is decent. Not fabulous, but pretty good. So if you're an audiophile, look elsewhere. But for playing music or stories on long car trips, it works. To play soothing sounds streamed from your phone or laptop while on a trip, this works fine. But for really great sound quality you might want to look elsewhere.

We love this little speaker. It is pocket size and easy to use. Having a volume button would make it even better, but, we love the sound quality, so adjusting volume on the laptop is no big deal. The speaker takes a tinny sound to an easy to understand mid range sound for voice and music. We purchased a much more expensive model at Best Buy and returned it once we heard the sound quality. This one was hands-down better for us. It comes with a great little carrying bag, charger and sound plug-in cord. Previous reviews noted that you cannot charge and listen at the same time. This is true, but, you can use a wall charger or charge on your PC. Two easy options. All in all, a great purchase for us!

reviews.review_header: Awesomeness wrapped up in a little package
reviews.review_text: The Anker ultra portable bluetooth speaker is proof that great things come in small packages. The small form factor is great if you're looking for something portable and pocket size and barely weighs anything. The 12hr single charge battery life is no joke. I received mine 3 days ago and have yet to charge it and that's with playing about 3 - 4 hrs a day. It comes with a pouch and charge cable (MIcro USB to USB) and Aux cable (Micro USB to headphone) The kicker for me was the sound quality and amazing power this little speaker puts out. If you're looking for booming bass, this speaker may not be what you're looking for but there is sufficient low end and more than I expected and best of all it's only $19.99 w/ Prime. Only issue is no capability to answer phone calls over speaker. Shipping to me in Hawaii came out to about $24 because I'm not a prime member yet. Still cheaper than others I've researched. Enjoy.

This little cube ROCKS. The amount a bass pumping out of this thing is incredible. Don't get me wrong, I doesn't have the thundering bass of a sub-woofer or big boom box, but the bass it does deliver is pretty cool. I have owned about 10 Bluetooth Speakers, and they were all larger than this one, but none of them pumped out bass like this one. The Highs are very high, the Mid and vocals are clear. Even my 11 year old son said he can hear instruments with this speaker that he doesn't hear on other speakers. Amazing...simply amazing. I had my iPod Classic plugged into this Cube on my desk and the next thing I knew it was on the floor. It took a 3 foot drop and kept playing. I picked it up and placed it back on my desk. I kept my eye on it this time and noticed it was bouncing across my desk from the bass.

I have this hanging off of a 7 port USB 3.0 hub tied to a Wintel laptop. This tiny little footprint really packs a punch. I use it as a PC speaker, not a music speaker. If you need the latter, get something bigger. This is perfect for a PC speaker, especially if you are in tight quarters. I leave the USB cable plugged into the hub for power and connect to the lapper via Bluetooth for sound. The connection is not perfect and requires you to hit the power button to initiate, but that is a small price to pay for a speaker w/such a small footprint but such a big impact. I need sound mainly to alert me if incoming soft phone calls or IMs.

Loved the sound from such a tiny speaker and it worked fine for couple of occasions. Yes, it has static and it sound does cutoff little aggressively when there is silence in the track, so you can imagine this speaker is not good for Podcasts. As the novelty of the purchase wore off I had shelved it along with countless junk that one tend to accumulate. However few days ago thought of carrying this tiny wonder speaker to a picnic and to my disappointment it was not working. The speaker doesn't charge now, glows a red light on the switch if pressed. I tried multiple chargers and connected to my desktop computer, nothing helped. Any suggestions?

The little speaker that packs punch! You will be amazed at the amount of sound coming from this tiny cube. I purchased this speaker after seeing and hearing a co-worker playing his. I have tried many tiny speakers and nothing comes close to this one. It is very convenient and fits pretty much anywhere. It comes with a nice bag, but you really won't need it. It has a tough exterior so I don't worry about getting it damaged or scratched. It also comes with a micro USB charging cable and a USB to 3.5mm jack to connect to non-bluetooth sources. You want this speaker. If you have been looking for a portable sound that is excellent and not pricey...look no further. The usefulness, volume, battery life, and sound quality make this a no brainer purchase. You won't suffer buyer's remorse.

This little speaker sounds amazing and it worked perfectly right out of the box. It's a good idea to read the instructions for this one as the lights may be a little confusing, but it sounds great! My dad and I are both very impressed with how awesome it sounds in such a little package. It gets very loud, and I don't have to turn it up that much for it to be perfect. It comes with a USB to micro-USB cable for charging AS WELL as a mini-jack (I don't remember if it's 3/8in or 1/8in) to micro-USB cable so that you can connect it to a device that may not have Bluetooth. It also comes with a nice Anker branded pouch to put it while not in use. It's an amazing product and I love it!

AMAZING SPEAKER , I heard great reviews and i was alittle sceptical cause its so small and youtube videos that showed it and played songs it was hard still to determine how loud itd be ,But holy crap guys i just got it this morning and man my family and me were blown away with the sound i live in a small apartment and you can hear it throught out the whole house. The range is amazing too i could walk away 20ft with my phone still no problems . I even went in the bedroom (speaker in the living room ) so about 25ft away with several walls inn the way and still no problems all thought when i moved it around it would cut in and out but if i left my phone still on the table the music would play just fine. The only thing that sucks which isnt a reflextion of the product .just would be nice if you could make calls .or atleast hear the caller through the speeaker.

reviews.review_header: Nice speaker, not for a party or even a small gathering, just one person use
reviews.review_text: This tiny speaker packs a punch, but it isn't loud enough for a party.Know that you can always easily get a replacement for free if it breaks (I did for a different anker product) Pros: Portable Lasts a long time Sufficient sound for a person Reasonable price Cons: Easy to lose Not for a party Overall, if you just want a speaker to boost up netflix music or YouTube, this is great, but this is not for a party. Side note: I think anker is a great company, high quality products and easy replacements.

Good little speaker. I use it at work so I can't comment on how it sounds really loud as I listen to it on the lowest volume possible. In fact, my only complaint would be that the volume doesn't go lower. I use it with an iPhone 6, so that may be the issue, volume may vary by phone. It stays charged for a pretty good amount of time. I only need to charge it every couple of days and listen to it 8-9 hours a day. I also like that it does not have phone capabilities, per se. When I get an incoming call the music stops and the phone call is taken through my phone, not the speaker. This was one of the main reasons I selected this speaker.

First, I bought this item and did not get it free to try. I have multiple Anker battery packs and thought the quality was great, so I thought I'd give this a try. It is super small. However, the sound is very good. It gets plenty loud and will fill one to two rooms with music. The bass isn't killer but it is good enough. The battery life seems to be good so far. Usually my phone dies first. (Bluetooth) It send to charge up pretty quick too. One thing I don't like is that they do not recommend that you charge the speaker while it is on. Disappointing since I carry external battery packs for reasons like that. Overall, I think for the price, you can't go wrong with this speaker. It is super small and portable and gives out good sound. Throw it in your bag or pocket and you could have a party anywhere.

I ordered this for my husband, he is not really savvy with electronics and has no intention to change that because he feels any electronic that is hard to use or figure out does not make his life simpler. So when he told me that he didn't like the way his Bluetooth in our car that's a couple years older sounds linked to his iPhone, and he wanted a small speaker he could play "his" music in the car. This speaker definitely fit the bill, the speaker is small but powerful and fits in a little nook in the car and the sound is great. This is easy to link by Bluetooth or connecting by wire to the phone and USB to charge.

Tiny but very well-built and has that high quality feel to it. I was actually surprised as to how good this little speaker feels like to the touch once I unpackaged it. It also comes with a small soft but durable fabric pouch for when you're not using it. The sound was crisp and clear but lacks the heavy bass. Then again it's a tiny speaker so don't expect too much bass. I use it when I'm in the kitchen, and it does fill the place with sound. Lasted 2 full movies on my phone and still had juice to go but I had to sleep. I give it 5 stars for the quality build and battery capacity, 4 stars for that little lack of strong bass.

Honestly I didn't expect much from this. I thought it was a cheap bluetooth speaker that would be alright, and at $20 I was willing to take a risk. I was wrong. Right from opening the box I was impressed with the detail and thought put into it.The packaging was mostly cardboard, and the outside wrapper opened with a simple pull strip. It was completely frustration free packaging. When I opened the lid of the box I was greeted with a "Thank you for choosing Anker" message printed on the box. With the instruction pamphlet was a second pamphlet. On one side, it said "Unhappy? Let us know at...." and on the other "Happy? Let us know at..." (I'm paraphrasing a bit, because I tossed the paperwork a couple of weeks ago.) My overall impression before even using the product was that the company really cared about user experience. I looked at the pictures before I bought it, but it didn't sink how small it is until I held it. It is tiny. I can almost wrap my hand all the way around it, which means it's an easy addition when I'm traveling. It looks really nice, with a very simple design. I also really liked the rubber bottom to help it stay put when you put it down. Using the speaker was really simple. I turned it on, paired it with my phone and started playing music. Because of the small size, I figured it would be pretty quiet. Wrong again. It was actually too loud when I first used it. The volume is controlled by the device it's paired to, which isn't noted in the instructions and took me a minute to figure out. If needed, it can easily fill a 10' x 20' room with sound. (I haven't tried it in a bigger space yet.) The battery life is pretty good, we've been using it an average of a couple hours a day for about 3-4 weeks and I've only charged the battery 2-3 times. I've only noticed two downsides: At high volume, the sound gets a little tinny, but it is a tiny, inexpensive speaker and I pretty much never want it that load anyways. The other issue is when it gets to low battery, a voice comes and says "Battery Low" before shutting off. It's really jarring. We been using it to play soft music while our baby sleeps, and the first time that happened, my wife woke up and freaked a little (hearing a strange man's voice in our apartment in the middle of the night). Overall, really impressed with the size, ease of use, battery life, quality, and attention to detail Anker put into their product.

reviews.review_header: love it. Sounds it awesome and its super compact
reviews.review_text: about to be a year with it, love it. Sounds it awesome and its super compact. The base is super nice especially when it comes from something so small you don't expect it. I've taken it pretty much everywhere with me while on my bike and during vacations, just love it. The build is also nice to the touch and you can feel the quality. Overall I didn't really expect much for such a small and inexpensive speaker but this one really surpassed my expectations and I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_header: This is really very good customer service
reviews.review_text: After the review I was contacted by Anker customer service. They pointed me to a different model that have a built in microphone and bigger unit. This is really very good customer service. I've bought a few Anker brand items including multiple battery packs, usb power ports/chargers I've never had issues with their products, I would consider buying their products before making my decision on what to buy. Great customer service and great warranty. Thank goodness I've never had to use it yet. Anker Classic Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker, Powerful Sound with Enhanced Bass, 20 Hour Battery Life, and Built-in Mic, works with iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Nexus, HTC, Laptops and More (Black)

reviews.review_header: I really like the extremely compact size of the speaker
reviews.review_text: I really like the extremely compact size of the speaker, very handy. Though I haven't any portable speakers with which to compare, the sound quality is good and meets my needs. I'm impressed with the speediness of recharge and the amount of play I got after recharge. The minimal size of the box the speaker came in impressed me. There are two cords that came with it for charging - wish the little storage bag allowed just the slightest bit more room to shove the cords and speaker all in, but with a little maneuvering it all goes in okay (not at all a dealbreaker). Great price, great size, pleased with my purchase.

Great little speaker. I use it almost everyday. Not intended to use for parties but will give plenty of sound for a couple of people hanging out or fill up the garage while working. A charge seems to last for ever and I will use it for hours at a time. I probably charge it once a month at the most. Great speaker, would recommend if you're looking for a small speaker that is not your phone. Size is just as small as it looks so that makes it easy to tote around. Bluetooth works perfectly, only probably is if your phone gets out of the line of sight it with break up. If you stay in line of sight of the speaker you can get good playback at 20-30 feet.

reviews.review_header: So far I love it! For the price and size
reviews.review_text: So far I love it! For the price and size, this speaker has really good sound quality. I especially love the design of the package; it shows that this brand really cares about its products and clients. The design of the speaker itself is very simple and clean, with only one button you'll need. I haven't had the chance to do it yet, but I'm excited to put this speaker to use when I'm with friends or family.

I bought this during an Anker sale for $20. For the size and what it is, that's a fantastic price. The sound is good - I wouldn't call it great. But it beats a cell phone speaker and gives you a bit more bass while filling the room with a more expansive sound. It's easy to connect via Bluetooth and charges with a microUSB cable. There you have it. Simple sound made portable by Anker.

reviews.review_header: This is an amazing little speaker
reviews.review_text: This is an amazing little speaker. I was surprised by how tiny it was, and even more surprised by the incredible sound that comes from it despite its size. The one and only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because it doesn't have its own, independent volume control. I bought this to play music at my desk at work, and on the very lowest volume setting on my iPhone, the music is slightly too loud for the office setting. Unfortunately, I can't turn it down any further without totally muting it. Because of that, I may have to exchange this product, and I really hate to do that because I am so impressed with it. If I could turn it down one more notch I'd keep it without a doubt.

reviews.review_header: Tiny sound from a tiny speaker.
reviews.review_text: Too small and too quiet. Spend a little more for a larger one of their speakers.

reviews.review_header: Excellent little speaker and very quick to pair
reviews.review_text: I have purchased other small speakers to use with my iPad and iPhone, including the much more costly Braven 570. This one is very compact and easily pairs with either device right out of the box. Simple off/on button on bottom and USB charging port on top. Unlike other speakers it is very simple and easy to use and pairs immediately. The sound quality is much better than comes with the devices, but not as good as that of the Braven 570 and some other compact, but more expensive speakers. I love the fact that it takes up such little space. A great buy for the money!

I ordered this speaker based on the strength of the other Anker products I've purchased in the past. The speaker arrived on time, was packaged in the standard Anker-style box, and was not damaged. It includes a USB-to-microUSB cable, a 3.5mm accessory cable, and a very nice case to hold it all. The speaker itself was a very clean, small cube. So far, so good. I turned it on, paired it to my iPhone (via bluetooth) using the included instructions, and started an audio book through Audible. The sound was good, not great. And then I noticed some type of clipping. When a book is narrated there are natural breaks on the speech, and the speaker was clipping the first few milliseconds of speech after a break...very annoying. This doesn't happen in my car, or with other bluetooth speakers. Might work OK with the accessory cable. Might work OK listening to music, but that's not my expected use. Unfortunately, I threw away the packaging so can't return it.
Made a hissing sound while playing movies...returned product!

I like a little music while I work, but don't want to wear headphones or turn on the tv when I travel for business. I have a few other bt speakers, but wanted something that took up very little space in my carry on (why check bags?) Anker ALWAYS has good products (I've bought a ton of their stuff) so I was glad this came to me as well as the others. Nicely packaged with all the right cables. The battery lasts a good long time, longer than the battery on my phone. Sound is good, although I suspect self-professed audiophiles will be disappointed and it will fill a room. The only thing I don't like is the USB/Audio In cable. I wish that the audio in was built into the device, as now I have to carry a separate cable to support my old school ipod. Other than that, it's getting the job done well.

reviews.review_header: Easy to use Long battery life Cons
reviews.review_text: Pros: Booming sound SMALL! Easy to use Long battery life Cons: No volume button on the speaker itself. After a full day of abusing this speaker with heavy, loud, bassy music it still held its ground. It pumps out MUCH better sound then the Groove Cube, and the Bluetooth range and connectivity is great! Just don't expect to go more then 50' away. Truthfully I would purchase this speaker again even if it was $35. This was an awesome buy! And the packaging was beautifully compact. You control the volume with your music device.

reviews.review_header: good sound, lightweight, compact... definitely recommend
reviews.review_text: this little speaker has good sound quality, it's lightweight and fits perfectly in my pocket. I couldn't give it 5 stars because the battery died after about 9 hours of use with the bluetooth volume at about 80%. I did make sure to fully charge the speaker before using it for the first time. I mainly use it at work and I sometimes turn the volume up to 100% for a song or two, but then turn it back down. Overall, it's a great speaker and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. The only other problem is that my tablet wouldn't find it via bluetooth. It wouldn't find another bluetooth speaker that I bought either, but I was able to connect to this speaker using NFC.

This classy and astounding little bluetooth speaker is everything it's cracked up to be. As soon as you unpack it and feel the texture and heft, you know that despite the ridiculously low price and tiny size, this is not cheap goods. Plus, it comes with a nice little velour travel bag. It pairs easily, holds a 12-hour charge - and SOUNDS FANTASTIC. And that, ladies and gentlemen, is what goes on the scoreboard. If you've never heard of them, here's the deal: Anker products are top-of-the-line and reasonably priced. Plus, customer service is superb. Check it out: http://www.anker.com I'm a fan for life.

reviews.review_header: It's portable it's easy to use it's reasonably priced
reviews.review_text: It's portable it's easy to use it's reasonably priced. So far I really like it. I mean I wasn't expecting Bose sound quality but for its size and its price is pretty decent. UPDATE - for some reason the speaker stopped working. The customer support was phenomenal. They reached out to me immediately and were fast courteous and efficient and are sending me a replacement unit. Honestly it's very rare that I've had such fast easy and efficient experiences with customer support. Top-notch. If the replacement speaker fails I'll update this review accordingly but otherwise I'm giving five stars for the time being.

reviews.review_header: Impressed Right Out of the Box
reviews.review_text: Wow. I cannot believe the sound that is coming out of this ultra tiny box. Bluetooth sync was seconds with iPhone 6s with out any issues. Walked away from the phone carrying the Anker in my hand for about 40 feet it kept playing without hesitation. Bought this for a travel but I am actually going to use around the house full time. The sound is amazing. Now it's not going to replace your Bose or Beats Bluetooth speakers but you don't want to carry those around anyway. Nice small size to fit in a bag or pocket. Charged for about 45 minutes out of the box and was ready to go. I'm truly impressed!

reviews.review_header: Nice sound for the size and price point
reviews.review_text: Great product -- tiny form factor, but nice sound given the size. I have a much much bigger bluetooth speaker I use at home that definitely has bigger sound, but for something going into a suitcase, the Anker device is pretty good. If you put the Anker device on a hollow piece of furniture (e.g. a dresser or desk with a drawer underneath the surface), the furniture serves like a subwoofer, improving the bass sound. The one thing that would have been nice to include is a microphone, so that the Anker device could serve as a speakerphone. Their next larger size version does have a microphone.

reviews.review_header: Fantastic little speaker that gets the job done
reviews.review_text: I needed a portable bluetooth speaker to use with the app for the game "One Night: Ultimate Werewolf" and this was perfect. I've been using this for about 2 weeks now and it's great. It's SUPER compact (the cables and speaker all fit in a little included felt bag). Setup with my iPhone was easy. Charging was quick and it connected easy. When I purchased I feared it wouldn't be loud enough, but it was more than enough for a group of a dozen people standing around a table to hear. I would say this is great for a tabletop setup or small room. It packs a good punch, especially for its size. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_header: A Big Sound From A Small Box
reviews.review_text: This thing is loud considering its size (it's really tiny, like a small wedding ring box). Sound quality is what you would expect from this tiny box, mediocre. It can get a bit distorted when it's too loud. Considering its size, there's a small bass kick, so if you're looking for a replacement for your phone speaker this product here is a good alternative. This product does have an AUX in the form of MicroUSB, so you cannot charge the speaker and listen to your music at the same time if your using the AUX.

I have purchased this speaker for listening to music at a gym since earbuds annoy me big time. It is really perfect for listening music if you are a few steps away. I have read guys complaining about it being not powerful enough or a bluetooth coverage not being strong enough. A I mentioned it is for the music a few steps away. If you want to fill the room just look for the bigger one. The quality of music is very nice for such a small device - it handles all the hard rock and heavy metal I put it through. I also like the NFC compatibility. No jibber jabber with bluetooth devices menu just press it gently on a phone - voila, your Anker is connected. Device design is just flawless - it's plain cool black cube. The less is more at this case, Anker. Good job.

reviews.review_header: Buy it for yourself, play it for everyone.
reviews.review_text: It's little, fits in the size of my XL manly size hand! I have friends who heard the little speaker and are surprised at the sound quality. The button is for on and off. There aren't any adjustments on the device, that is maintained from whatever device being used to push bluetooth from. However, if you want a small bluetooth speaker, this is pretty nice. I looked at Bose, which my friend got and it's a great device, however, it won't fit in the palm of the hand or a pocket. I will connect my tablet to his, put on music, put the speaker on, take the bluetooth speaker into the bathroom and shower! It's not waterproof, so, I leave it on the bathroom counter. Or, if I'm watching Netflix or Hulu, etc., via my tablet, I can have this speaker on, piping the sound via the bluetooth speaker.

reviews.review_header: Small loud 11 hours on a full charge bluetooth speaker
reviews.review_text: Love this speaker. I wanted it for my t.V. and it sounds great. You can't make or receive phone calls on this Bluetooth device but that's what I like. I wanna listen to my music and t.V. without the sound pausing for phone calls or text message's. This is a simple and loud very tiny Bluetooth speaker which lasts 11 hours on a charge and sounds great. Includes headphone plug adapter for mp3 players , t.V. with headphone jack output the small type headphone jacks. See my pic for jack type
Did not work won't charge

I adore this speaker, easily the best 20 bucks I've spent in months. My specific need was for a conveniently small speaker I could pair with my Asus T-100 when running tabletop games. This speaker performed above and beyond in every category I needed -- it syncs super easily, last for a good 10 hours (at least -- I haven't run it all the way down yet), responds quickly, and has a solid sound to it -- good range and volume. In a fairly noisy room, I can play ambient music through this in the center of a standard round folding table and 7 adults can all hear it fine without having to blast the volume to 10. Great Speaker, Great Price.

Love this tiny speaker. I'm using it in my office at work. Its tiny footprint is perfect for my desk. Great sound. Very loud. In fact, I have to turn down volume when using it or it disturbs those in offices next door to mine. Have not yet had occasion to use it at full volume. Sound is clear and full bodied. Charge holds for quite a long time. Although I haven't measure it, the charge lasts longer than my work day. On the first day I brought it to my office, two co-workers bought units for themselves. Will be buying more for gifts.

Edit 8/25/16 Received a replacement and seems to work okay for a couple of hours at a time. Will need to test out longer time frame to ensure the battery life is decent Though it's portable, the battery does not last. As with other Anker products I've tried, this is not my favorite. It could literally only hold the charge for an hour or 2 before it tells me it's low on battery (a voice will say "low battery").. the volume is great for my MacBook Pro when it is working. I haven't used it since 2 months after I purchased it...

Not the greatest quality sound, but hey, this is a very small speaker and it is LOUD. Bought it for my daughter's Fire 6 and she uses it every dad. Now, I can hear all hear favorite show while she does her chores ALL THE WAY INTO MY OFFICE WITH THE DOOR CLOSED!!! lol! It is great fro watching television and movies (audio) and popular music (in my opinion),but I would not listen to classical or jazz, etc (in music listening, I am a snob). Day to day music listening and such it is great, the volume is more than awesome. My daughter and her friends use it all the time.
I can not believe how good this tiny little speaker sounds! It has a nice rich sound, decent volume. It's so easy to sync and set up. I'm so impressed!

Great sound for such a small speaker!!! I have a couple different size Bluetooth speakers and this has the most bang for its 2in cubed size. Charges very fast in under an hour and I get at least 4 hours of battery life playing music, probably still even more juice in there. For under $20 bucks I highly recommend if you are looking for a compact unit with great sound! Comes with standard Android charge micro USB port for charging and charge cable and an Aux to USB cord too if you are using a non Bluetooth device.

reviews.review_header: Great sound for a speaker of this size!
reviews.review_text: After reading reviews for this speaker I decided to try it based on positive comments and it's small size. I received it yesterday and just turned it on today- the sound is really pretty darn great for a tiny speaker of this size and price! I've only been listening to it for the past hour, but the volume (managed via your bluetooth connected device) is seriously impressive for $20! Is it Bose/Harmon quality? No- but I didn't want a $100+ speaker for traveling- just something small that I could bring on the beach or use in my hotel room with good battery life, sound quality, and volume. This hit the spot- I'm really pleased!

reviews.review_header: Excellent sound, Excellent base, Wonderful size.
reviews.review_text: Bought as a gift, Excellent sound, Excellent base, Wonderful size. This Bluetooth speaker, sounds great with Caribbean Music, Old school dub, sounds fantastic, bringing across the rich base that is part of this genre, every other genre including hip hop sounds surprisingly good for the size. Works great to add a volume to an older laptop without Bluetooth with the included micro USB to 3.5 mm headphone jack cable. My only worry comes from the possibility of misplacing the above mentioned cable, not sure how easily it would be to replace, would probably have to have to order that. Overall, a great item and I will look to Anker again in the future; whenever, I am in the market for another Bluetooth speaker.

This tiny bluetooth speaker is a well made device that delivers strong and most importantly, clear sound. Of course the bass is a little lacking; I think just by design it can't deliver the lows that a larger speaker can, but playing classical, jazz and rock, the sound is very rich and full. What it excels at is clarity. Played low or high, you can hear just about everything in the recording. I use this with my iphone and the connection between the two devices is seamless. I like that it comes with a small, soft pouch. Charging time is under two hours if you connect it to a wall outlet (I used the wall plug from my iphone, connected it to the micro usb cable that came with the speaker). No issues whatsoever. An excellent portable bluetooth speaker!

reviews.review_header: My favorite electronics purchase this year
reviews.review_text: And that is saying a lot because I probably buy 10 gadgets a month from Amazon, including at least a dozen portable bluetooth speakers through the years. This one is the best - incredibly good sound, particularly given the size. Pay atetntion the picture - it is really tiny, but it has better output than some speakers I have 3x the size. And it is pretty hard to beat the price. Comes with a nice little bag and easy to understand instructions. I bought three and am buying 3 more at this moment. I'm going to not onlyl travel with it, but will keep I have 3 residences and can afford to keep one each at this price. Highly recommended.

Newest update: Anker contacted me directly when my unit wouldn't connect to anything. They emailed me right away and sent out a replacement. AMAZING customer service. The unit itself is stellar so I'm really happy I get to use it! Purchase this product. It's awesome, very sturdy, has amazing sound, tons of playback time, connects easily, and is supported by a top notch company willing to help. I am sure that my first unit was a bit faulty from the get go, so rest assured your unit will probably not have the same issues mine had. Even if it does, Anker is willing to send out a replacement, which is awesome.

I have a couple other Anker products so I felt comfortable buying this mini Bluetooth speaker. I was not disappointed. The sound is very good for such a small speaker. It has some bass to it and the volume is certainly loud enough. The speaker itself does not have a volume control. You must use the volume control on the device you pair it to. This is a mono speaker not stereo but it is perfect for listening to music at your desk or watching a movie on your tablet. I do recommend this speaker especially for the price.

I listen to audio books in the car (a car without Bluetooth) and have been frustrated by the FM receivers. Too many stations these days. So rather than spend several hundred dollars on Bluetooth, I looked for a compact speaker.... and this one fills the bill. For the size, great sound (can be a little tinny on the high end but for books that's a minor issue), pairs easily with my devices, and small enough to throw in the console when the car is parked. Great value.

reviews.review_header: Great sound from such a little speaker. You'll be surprised how good this speaker really is.
reviews.review_text: Great little speaker that surprises me all the time. First off, this thing can put out a lot of high quality sound. My car doesn't have blue tooth with the stereo and rather than get an fm receiver (never had good luck with those) and accompanying wires, I got this little speaker. Sure it's only one speaker, so your not going to get true stereo sound from it, but you will be surprised how good the sound quality really is. Well worth the price. I will be getting some as gifts this year, especially for teens who are usually wearing ear buds and not hearing/listening! This won't take care of the not listening, but should help with the not hearing. ;)

reviews.review_header: Great choice to increase volume on android tablet
reviews.review_text: This is just what I was looking for. I upgraded my tablet to a Samsung Galaxy Tab S and the volume is much too low on the speakers. I downloaded three different "volume boost" apps, but none of them worked (at all). I take the tablet to skilled nursing facilities along with my therapy dog each week. Some of the patients can no longer easily converse. I've found that if I estimate their age, I can pick out songs from their youth and play them on YouTube and they love it. This little speaker works great to boost the volume high enough to be heard over all the nursing facility background noise. It reproduces the full range, including base.

The perfect combination of sound quality and portability! I have had about 30 different Bluetooth speakers. This is my favorite. Every Bluetooth speaker has a different market or niche. This is perfect for walking around the neighborhood with a concert in your pocket. If you want something that is stereo for your desktop, or living room, this may not meet your needs. This is more than enough sound for a kitchen or dorm room. Remember these things only get so loud, but the volume on this one will truly shock you. This of course depends on your expectations.

This little cube puts out some great sound! The controls are simple and easy to grasp: one power/pairing button and a micro usb port that pulls double duty as a charging port and an auxiliary output. It pairs very quickly, connects quickly after it's been paired to a device, has great battery life, and it gets plenty loud for my needs. The sound quality is excellent for a speaker this size. My only downside with this speaker is that you can't charge it at the same time you use it with the auxiliary connection, but that's a minor gripe in the grand scheme.

reviews.review_header: Big disappointment! I expected better from Anker
reviews.review_text: Sometimes a defective one slips throught.......Anker made good on their name and i love my new speaker. Massive Distortion! Big disappointment! I expected better from Anker. I love their products but this one is just not good at all. If there was no distortion of buzzing it would get 5 stars but even on the easiest low bass songs it buzzes and distorts (yea I even put it on a soft surface). Very disappointed. This was going to be my go to for international travel. At least I have my Plantronics headphones and Bose Noise Cancelling in ear buds. Does anyone know if other of these products have distortion?
For the size, this speaker has great sound! We use it in the offices and it covers about 500 sq ft clearly and a comfortable level.

So compact, yet it provides such great sound quality. Bluetooth range could be better, but that's just me being picky. This easily fills up a smaller/medium sized room with clear, crisp sound. The battery lasts quite a while, and is relatively quick to charge. The speaker includes a 1m charging cable, as well as a 1m 3.5mm audio to micro USB if you wish to save your battery and play directly from your phone rather than over Bluetooth. It also works just fine with my laptop and desktop. I mainly listen to classic rock/metal, so I'm not too sure as to how it performs with other genres as I don't have enough experience listening to them, but it works perfectly for the type of music I enjoy! Most definitely worth ever dollar!

Great little speaker. Incredible sound from such a small speaker. It has a very high volume that does not distort the sound quality. For the price it is a great speaker. Long battery life, easy connection to bluetooth and also comes with a cord to connect an mp3 player if you don't have bluetooth. (The main reason I bought it) I didn't realize how small it really was until I opened up the package. The packing material was all high quality and very Apple like in its presentation. This is not a super high fidelity speaker, if that's what you are looking for buy something else. This speaker is better than one I bought my son for Christmas but this one is a quarter of the price.

reviews.review_header: Totally amazing sound for the size!
reviews.review_text: Oh my!!!! This tiny little box has amazing sound! Rubber bottom to keep it from sliding, nice blue light indicating it is on (i think it may turn red when charging but not sure), feels very professional, looks so neat and clean, and this little speaker sounds so good for it's size!! I love this little speaker even better than the Anker classic portable for portability, but the sound is just a little thicker on the Anker classic portable

This speaker was so cool! I think anyone (including myself) would be nervous that this speaker would not pack enough punch. I was wrong. It packs the punch! No it doesn't blow your ear off but the sound quality is great. With the proper placement you can fill a small room with sound. The battery life is good. Anker will see my business again for sure! What was most impressive besides the speaker is the packaging. You can tell from the start that you are receiving a high quality product. I love these portable speakers.

reviews.review_header: This is an absolutely EXCELLENT piece of technology
reviews.review_text: This is an absolutely EXCELLENT piece of technology. I was expecting a pretty poor speaker that would be fine for my very small office, but when I tested it out in my house I could easily hear the music from across the house. Excellent sound quality that you would expect from a much larger speaker. Everything comes through very clearly. Charges fairly fast, and has a great battery life once charged. I was very pleased with this purchase.

Amazing speaker with amazing sound and value! Would recommend this to everyone I know. I honestly didn't expect it to be so great. Pros: Amazing battery life Outstanding Sound Compact Size Wireless (also supports aux in) Cons: None! Buy this speaker, and you will not be disappointed. Here is the larger version: Anker Classic Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker, Powerful Sound with Enhanced Bass, 20 Hour Battery Life, and Built-in Mic, works with iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Nexus, HTC, Laptops and More (Black)

I like this thing a lot. It's very small and easy to use, and it works great! You control the volume by adjusting the volume from your device, so when you turn up your phone, this turns up as well. It gets pretty loud, and is great for use around the house. Came in very simply, easy to deal with packaging, and did not need to be charged when I got it. Actually, I haven't had to charge it at all yet! Before this I had a Beats Pill, for a zillion dollars -___- This works just as well, and for only $20. Totally recommend.

While I'm satisfied with most of my Amazon purchases, it is fairly rare for me to be truly excited by one, especially something as simple as a small, cheap, bluetooth speaker. But Aker's smallest, one button, speaker deserves six or seven stars. Connection is all but automatic from the very first, the sound to quite good and louder than expected. And while it is not a speaker phone, much to my surprise, it mutes when a call comes in, and then resumes the music when I hang up. An amazingly good product (!!)

This is a great wireless speaker. I work driving cars for a dealership. I drive a lot of different vehicles and do not like to attach my phone to new or customer vehicles. I wanted a very small speaker to carry with me mainly to listen to podcasts. I have bought several but have not been satisfied. One was too large to carry comfortably and one had poor volume.This speaker is perfect to fit my needs. It is small enough and has great volume for the size. It paired to my iPhone 6 Plus immediately. If you need a small speaker I definitely recommend this on. I have purchased several items under the Anker brand and have never been disappointed.

My personal one I bought over a year ago. Absolutely no problems! Very loud. But can be quiet with NO BUZZ sound. Distance of blue tooth is about 20-30 yards when out in the open and about 10-20 yards with walls and other obstructions in the way. The battery is still lasting 12-15 hours with about an hour to recharge!! The best way I can explain how impressed I am, I bought three more to give to family members for Christmas!

I rarely used it. Now that i'm using more it's shuts off while i'm listening to music, and at time I can hear someone talking too... Not good wasted my money I purchased Jan 2016 it's about my 6th time using it... Update: My granddaughter looked into the device, lo and behold it needed to be charged. :)
Wow, Big sound out of such a small speaker. Very portable and fits in your purse. Highly recommend

First Impressions 11/3/15: I bought this as a Christmas present for my sister. She's wanted a Bluetooth speaker for a while now and when I saw the size and price of this one I jumped at the chance. All she needs is something that can be played for herself or a small group of friends and so this was the perfect size. Obviously because of the size there is a lack of bass and it can't be turned up super loud but I can assure you that it is quality, feels well made and is great for personal listening or for a small get together. Will update later about the battery.

All of my friends have expressed their wonder that such a small speaker could sound so powerful. I love the convenience of it fitting in any purse, and filling any space with sound. I use it in my car for long drives (old car without a fancy audio system), indoor gatherings, and outside, without any problems hearing the music. I don't mind that you have to control the volume on your device (no buttons on the speaker), but if that's something you're looking for, make note. Best feature of all: the super long battery life that beats out most other bluetooth speakers popular on Amazon!
This speaker can not be charged while in use .

This Anker Ultra Portable Pocket Size Wireless Bluetooth speaker is nothing short of astonishing, in my opinion. The quality of sound that it puts out will likely surprise you. I leave few reviews; however, this item deserves a rave review. This small speaker sounds better than many larger and higher priced speakers. If you want great sound, a small speaker, and a low price, I highly recommend purchasing this little gem.

This product may be small but it works like a champ; I purchase for travel and decided to give it a try before my next travel and it really sounds great, it's room filling. I didn't expect it to work as it has, I needed something small, functional and has good sound quality. I have the Pill by Beats its small but still took up valuable space. The Anker portable speaker can fit in my purse or cosmetic case and is very portable. I will consider other Anker products in the future. I almost forgot it holds the charge for an extended period of time, if you are like me and take frequent short business trips, the charger can stay at home.

Impressed. As a tech person I'm hard to impress after having so many products daily, but this didn't failed to impress me. It have an small kind of funny form factor, sound quality is good even for bigger speakers, connectivity range is good although no stellar, battery performances outstanding, haven't recharge it yet after a week of random use. I haven't reviewed other ANKER products yet, but after this baby I'm nothing but excited to receive the next one.

I bought this amazing little speaker for my daughter's nighttime music and I want it for myself. The volume is nothing short of astonishing! The music is very clear with considerable bass and fidelity coming from this 2"x2"x2" cube. I didn't realize just how small it was until it was in my hand. It has considerable heft for its size and appears to be of excellent build and quality. I am unsure if you can buy two and have a stereo effect. Either way it's an amazing little speaker not much bigger than a large marshmallow. Get it!

reviews.review_header: Anker Ultra Portable size Wireless speaker
reviews.review_text: This little thing is amazing. It is not Kindle Fire Hdx compatible but I can still hook it up manually with the cord (which my dog ate soon after opening for Christmas lol) but another on its way! Hooked it up to daughters android lg vista cellphone tho via Bluetooth and was blown away with the sound and quality of this little banshee! Will buy another as soon as they are compatible though. Hurry please!

This is best product among my recent purchase. It is very cute size and great sound quality. I didn't expect such a great sound quality because of the size, but you will be surprised for such a great quality. it also has a pretty blue light when it's on which I love. Perfect size for traveling and also in the car. I have a old card that doesn't have bluetooth and this is great in my car. It's very easy to paring and last unbelievably long time. I would definitely time more from this company. I also wanted to add that their customer service was awesome.

reviews.review_header: I'm writing this review without compulsion from Amazon of my ...
reviews.review_text: I'm writing this review without compulsion from Amazon of my own Accord. I was looking for the smallest size Bluetooth speaker for my mom as a present and she doesn't care about sound just a small size that's ultra portable. This has it all : size, sound and portability. Oh yeah let's not forget price. What a steal at 20 bucks and let's just mention anker and their out of box experience. 5 stars. Clean, sharp, neat, and 20 bucks. This is a 5 star ' deal in every sense , and with prime, it's a full win.

reviews.review_header: A great speaker at a low price!
reviews.review_text: The five star rating is based on expectations, price and performance. This little gizmo is just great. It's compact yet powerful and unbelievably low priced. For the price you don't expect Bose quality but I was pleasantly surprised as the music from my phone filled my family room with full,rich sound. I got just what I was looking for at a good price. I've paid more for portable speakers that weren't as compact so they aren't used much. This unit is simple to pair to you phone, iPod or iPad, works well with wired devices and convenient to carry too! Very pleased with this product.

reviews.review_header: This little speaker is only 1/6 the price of my previous bluetooth speaker yet delivers good sound, is easier to connect
reviews.review_text: Entirely impressed. I use it almost daily in educational workshops where I set it in the middle of the table and walk about streaming music clips from my phone. This little speaker is only 1/6 the price of my previous bluetooth speaker yet delivers good sound, is easier to connect, and seems to keep a perfect wireless connection. The quality is excellent - it feels great in the hand, and the button is solid. I also like that it has no external volume control...all this is simply provided by my phone or other device. The price is so good I bought a second so that one is always paired to my phone, and the other stays paired to my laptop.

This product is wonderful! It is tiny, but I have an 1800 sq ft home and you can here it all around my house. The battery life is also great. I charged it once and have used it for about 6 hours and it's still working. I would highly recommend it. Don't let it's tiny size fool you.

reviews.review_header: The best value purchase electronic device I've ever made.
reviews.review_text: So here's a speaker, bluetooth-touch enabled, for $20. It is indestructible, water proof, has a 12 hour battery life, and fits in your pocket. I don't know what else there is to say. It's an amazing product that comes with amazing customer support and an 18 month warranty, and the sound quality is solid as well. What else do you want? It has dozens of bells and whistles and costs $20 bucks while fitting in your pocket. Go buy it.

Simply AMAZING!!! This little power house is exactly what I needed for Traveling and with my MacBook Air. At first because of the price I paid and not knowing the company too well I crossed my fingers and ordered. When I powered the speaker up i could not believe how amazing the sound it produced and no distortion even at its loudest it's not "Bose" quality but amazing nonetheless. Voice reproduction is great especially watching movies. No complaints so far, this speaker is going with me everywhere especially because it's smaller than a wedding ring box!!!

When I was looking for a new portable Bluetooth speaker I didn't knew the Anker brand, and after reading all of the reviews I decided to give it a chance. I have to say that when I turned it on and the music started playing through it, I couldn't believe my ears. It's an amazing tiny thing. So far everything is perfect. Good quality product, simple design but good looking and more important than the other things is that it sounds great. Hope it last a few years.

reviews.review_header: Great sound, however will not stay were placed due to vibrating. Recommended securing product before playing.
reviews.review_text: I luv Anker products, as I have bought several. This product produces a very good sound, I only wish it didn't move while playing due to vibrating. which causes the product to move. It almost ended in a tub of water due to the vibrating issue, however I noticed it had moved a considerable distance before it fell to it's demise. I am going to try and place on a rubber mat to hold it it place.

reviews.review_header: Much more powerful than I expected!!
reviews.review_text: I love this little speaker! I didn't expect to receive such full sound from a tiny little speaker. I purchased this because at times, when watching Netflix or Amazon on my computer, it was hard to always hear dialogue. This little speaker has completely solved that problem. I often find myself having to turn down my computer's volume because this little dynamo is so powerful. I do wish that I could use this speaker and recharge it at the same time. But for the price and quality of this speaker, this isn't a big deal. Definitely worth purchasing.

reviews.review_header: Nice portable speaker with 12 hours play time
reviews.review_text: Very nice and easy to use mini Bluetooth speaker. Fully charged, lasts 12 hours ( according to the users manual ) which is far more than most portable speakers in the same category which is why I bought it. It's a basic speaker with no volume controls or capability to advance to next song. One little power button and volume is adjusted by whatever main stereo/listening device you are pairing from. Come with all necessary cables and is able to be connected to other speakers with the 3.5mm cable that comes with it. Nice basic speaker that sounds great and great price too.

Very Good Speaker for Laptop or Cellphone. Sounds better than my Laptops Altec speakers. Product arrived 2 day via Prime. Packaged well. Undamaged and in perfect working order. Didn't buy it for the Bluetooth as I use Linux Mint and it is not operational at this time. I had to buy an RCA audio (red & white) to Female 1/8in. mini plug to use it for my LCD TV because it's speakers are facing towards the rear. I didn't want to use my 2.1 speakers/sub-woofer system plus it's wires. Sound is superb for the size. The cables included (charger & ext. speaker) work well. Very good product and transaction. Would buy from this vendor again!

Seriously, IMO Oontz Curve is a much better speaker. So why 5 stars? This thing is only 1.75" on a side, has a 12 hr (advertised) run time, plays loud enough and is VERY portable. Construction feels solid. Overall tonality is well into the midrange comparable to Roverbeats T3 but with less low tones. I don't use the word bass with these types of speakers because they lack the capability. Pleasant listening at moderate volume and if you want to mellow the sound a bit, place it on top of a small empty cardboard box. Definitely a keeper.

Great little speaker. Loud for it's size and a pretty decent battery life. Because if it's size I didn't expect too much bass out of it, which it didn't deliver anyway. Would have enjoyed ffw and rwd buttons. You are only able to pause the music with the speaker and play it.

It is an inexpensive speaker. I have not had it long enough to really get an informed opinion, but Anker sent me an unwelcome email demanding a review.I just wanted to buy the cheap item and be left alone to enjoy my music, not contacted by customer service.

reviews.review_header: A few things to keep in mind...
reviews.review_text: The cube itself does NOT have a volume control...so if you're looking for it, you won't find it. The volume is controlled by your phone (or whatever device you've connected to it). It's small, but it's pretty mighty! Maybe I was asked to turn it down a few times. Maybe. It turns off whenever your'e away for a few minutes. I haven't figured out what the time frame is, but the bluetooth gets super lonely, super quick and turns the speaker off. Battery life seems to last a couple of days, based on a 8 hour workday.
