reviews.review_header: Perfect for music on go, BUT NOT AUDIOBOOKS! Long battery life.
reviews.review_text: UPDATE: This speaker still awesome, so long as you don't listen to Audio Books. Music will do just fine with this product... but not audio Books. Why? I am not sure, but I think it has to do with Voice Activated Power... whatever one would call it. Regardless of what one calls it the problem is that it cuts out when the speaker stops talking. Well, that sounds fine, you may think, "I don't want it to waste battery if the speaker / narrator stops talking!" :) Yes, I agree. But the problem is that it cuts out FAR TOO QUICKLY. Less than a half-second pause, and this thing cuts off. And of course, it cuts right back on a millesecond later. BUT WHEN IT COMES BACK ON, it will always clip a word or half a word. THAT BECOMES VERY ANNOYING. WHen the narrator delivers at even a somewhat slower pace, the cut-out, cut-in process will be through-out your narration, and it will be almost impossible to understand. NORMAL READING SPEED WILL CAUSE THIS TO CUT OFF AND CUT IN. What is it like? Something like this: "ou may wander what the 5 most exotic animals are. ---r list includes: _ats _ogs _ice _rmadillo _angaroo. " Every pause at a period, comma, or list will certainly cause this, whether the narrator reads fast or slow. Of course, music doesn't present a problem because there is always music in the backgrounds (or background noise of some kind) while the lyrics are being played. I have to take away 2 stars. I should take away more, since I really use this mostly for AudioBooks now. This seems like a no brainer to fix for the company... but why even release this product like this. Would setting the PAUSE rate to only kick in for a half-selcond pause (this would fix 90% of it) really cause such a drain on battery life? If they set it for a full second, it would almost never be a problem in Audio Books. But set as it is now... say, a quarter second??... and it becomes really bothersome. Oh, to answer the question, "how do you know it is not your source (Samsung Phone) that is the problem?" Simple: I turn off the Anker speaker and there is NO cut-in and cut-out that happens. Only when audio goes through this speaker... and only audio books or narrated audio. By the way, when listening to some narrated audio (like a radio news program), I notice that the speaker doesn't cut-in and out. Why? Likely there is an audio background level that keeps the speaker live...even white noise can have a audio level. Audio books will always cause this problem, however. Two star deduction for Audio Book problem. Otherwise, a 5 star little speaker. Here is original review: Check out the size on this amazing little speaker. My battery life has been excellent. I took this 4 hours home, next day was four hours back....left in car overnight. Then two trips on the following two days....we are talking at least 12 hours of use, near full volume in car (until, see below). Great! Third Anker product...all a cut Above what the price would indicate. 5 stars on all. Glad I stumbled on to this gem. About the size of a ping pong ball or golf ball if it were a cube. Rounded edges. Sound doesn't match what it looks like. A few key points: Sound gets better as you place this unit on various objects! I think because of thin rubbery base, it actually gets louder and more full if you place, say, on a desk. Try several places (size makes that easy). I had a ceramic pencil holder with a bell curve...I flipped it over and placed this on it...new sound was impressive for music, not for audiobooks. I place on wood object and again, I could lower volume by a few because of design. Compared to Amazon Echo device: echo has great sound as numerous reviews indicate....but you know what happens when you play your phone audio through echo? (Not that one needs to do often)? Well, it flattens the audio and it is nice and loud but the Echo doesn't handle my galaxy phone audio very well. (Now, compare Echo in Amazons normal play mode ...no Bluetooth connection....well, the Echo stomps this little Anker...but that is to be expected! ) Size matters. Being small has had so many benefits. One is you can place this on many objects to see what sound is best for you. In my Prius, I initially put it in the cup holder. Works well there. But I then stuck it in little tray in dash firing outward. Nice. I tried on the visor...that is good if you want to lower volume cause it is closer to your ears, though you lose something in quality of sound up there. Then I placed on dash...just ok. Then near the visual display at back of dash...bingo! ...sound just was fabulous there. Small size also helps when taking to job or to friends. Listen while charging. Some reviewers say no. It does charge and play at same time (even when battery is drained). However, I had it plugged into a decently powerful car charger (also an Anker purchase) that has that new ability to see what the device needs (so a tablet will get more amps and a flip phone gets much less when charging. I plugged in to the Anker car charger and presto....had good sound again. Wonderful that it has no microphone! Some cars have phone audio (hands free operation] for smartphones...however, many will do the phone fine but not play audiobooks or music from your same smartphone. The Toyota Prius was known for this problem ...it has a great phone interface, but no addition sound from your phone. This anker has no mic, so that is perfect! Bluetooth speakers with phone capabilities are often not as good built in car units. So, if I get a phone call while listening to music on my Anker speaker (through my Samsung phone), well the Prius answers the call. No problem. If you want that mic feature on a Bluetooth speaker ..be sure to order that model. Price? Too good to even question the purchase. Quality? Higher than my older $100 stereo speakers! And much, much better than my Bluetooth Shower speaker (about same price) which was a waste of money compare to this Anker gem. 5 stars.... now 3 stars for audio books hiccup.

In my opinion Anker is one of the most underrated company's. I have bought multiple items from them, and they are all very sturdy, well built, with very clean packaging. And this speaker is no exception. The sound it produces is amazing, especially for its size. http://gajiteer.weebly.com/news/january-23rd-2015

This thing is tiny, but really packs a punch. Connects instantly with my Galaxy S5. Get a good equalizer app, and it really shines. My friends can't believe all that sound is coming from this tiny thing. Pretty amazing! Typical Anker quality - excellent.

It takes a few minutes to get who would need this tiny speaker and why. At first glance you might say, hey, $20 is nice but for under $50 I could get a bigger bluetooth speaker with far superior sound. TRUE. But the thing is it wouldn't be tiny anymore. Those speakers are like baseballs. This speaker is like a ping pong ball. Still -- why get this when even Anker itself offers a BIGGER speaker for like $35? Answer One: do you ever listen to music out of your smartphone? And feel like you're in TINNY hell? If you're a lady you can stick this ping pong ball sized speaker in your purse and pull it out when needed. This presumes you're away from your home where better speakers await. If you've managed a lunch outside somewhere and it's quiet enough -- turn on some music and relax. Answer Two: similarly have you ever had your laptop out and about and wished it had better sound? Not killer sound but simply better? Again, this will fit in most laptop bags and yet not weigh it down so much as to consider skipping it. Answer Three: Do you ever go to part of your house you wish had some sort of music? Like a laundry room? The garage? Places where you only visit it now and then and so you don't really need SPEAKER speakers set up? For me it's the bathroom where I shower. There's not enough room for real speakers but this speaker does this trick. And yes it can be heard over the running water. In fact this speaker sounds best in tighter spaces. Or really close to you -- if you were outside and doing some picnic-ing. Providing there's not a ton of noise or music around you. In this way this little speaker is simply amazing. Give it a try!

reviews.review_header: I love all the ANKER products I've bought
reviews.review_text: I love all the ANKER products I've bought. This speaker is GREAT! VERY compact & portable and very good sound quality.

Simple, elegant design, nice sound for its size, and the Bluetooth pairs easily with my iPhone -- pairs better than the larger, more expensive Bose speaker I have. Sounds better too than Amazon's own AmazonBasics Ultra-Portable Micro Bluetooth Speaker if you ask me.
Great sound from such a small speaker. I have used it for a bird caller with a Sibley Bird App and my iPhone.

reviews.review_header: Well worth the $, everyone likes it
reviews.review_text: As long as you're realistic that this isn't a boom box with lots of bass, you should be satisfied. MUCH louder and better sounding than tablet/phone speaker. Everyone who's seen mine has been amazed and wants one for themselves. Don't let anyone steal yours.

reviews.review_header: Very powerful with a nice sound. I use it when I'm doing yard ...
reviews.review_text: A unique and affordable speaker. Very powerful with a nice sound. I use it when I'm doing yard work relaxing on my patio or working out. I would highly recommend this speaker to all music listeners

reviews.review_header: Amazing quality in a small package
reviews.review_text: I am truly pleased with the quality of sound I get from this device. For as small as it it has a very high quality sound. Add to that the fact that it has a long lasting battery and is extremely easy to set up and us and you have a real winner. Highly recommended!

After receiving a defective speaker I was promptly contacted by an Anker rep that sent me a new one very quickly. This is quality customer service that rarely exists any more. The sound on this thing really big for its size and the battery lasts for a very long time.

reviews.review_header: Super easy to use. Sound can be better.
reviews.review_text: Very enjoyable. Super easy to connect then automatic connect. Super portable. Nice building quality. Super convenient to use. Its sound is loud, balanced, clear, yet not HiFi. Hope the next generation focuses on improving sound quality.

reviews.review_header: Great Product. Use it all the time
reviews.review_text: Great Product. Use it all the time. Met my expectations! and More. The smaller speaker by Anker By the way does not work as a speaker phone utilizing Bluetooth. That's why I bought the bigger one. But sound quality on both is A+

reviews.review_header: Great sound from a tiny little speaker!
reviews.review_text: I just wish that it had a microphone so that I could use it as an extension to my iPhone. Otherwise, in all other functions it works very well for its size. A real nice accessory!

Way more sound than you would expect from something so small. I really like it because we have some bigger ones and the sound really carries, but this one can just fill up one room, so it's more like a personal speaker than one to blast and share. I'm very pleased with it.

reviews.review_header: fortunately it is durable and has great sound quality so ...
reviews.review_text: My toddler thinks this is hers, fortunately it is durable and has great sound quality so she can dance till bed time without me being worried about a big radio or delicate speaker.

This makes 2 I have purchased from Anker of the same style of speaker. Positive points are the bluetooth or cable connection. Longevity of battery life. Excellent sound in a tiny package. I recommend this to any music lovers.

reviews.review_header: Very good wiresless speaker for the category
reviews.review_text: Great Buy I but it to try different Bluetooth speakers for the company, Anker ended up being one of the best vues O did. very small Vattery last enough for its size and Audio quality is very good. It has a great bag to keep it in and it charges with microusb, that is great too.
Great speaker for travel or whenever you need some portable music. The sound quality is amazing "considering" the size of the speaker.
Works great. I have used it both in Bluetooth mode and plugged into the audio out jack of a computer. Surprising volume and decent bass for such a small package.

For something this small, long battery life, and genuinely loud, im impressed. Ive always needed speakers to take on the go and with this I can go anywhere. Bluetooth works a good distance and Nfc makes things alot easier. Also, delivered a day earlier than estimated. Cool product and get one for yourself.

reviews.review_header: I love how compact this speaker is
reviews.review_text: I love how compact this speaker is. The set up was fairly easy and the simplicity makes it an overall great product. For a small product, the sound quality is decent and quite loud.
Incredible sound for such small device. Handy and easy to carry. I recommend it for small parties in places with no sound systems or speakers.
This tiny speaker gives a HUGE quality and sound to it! It's better than what I have expected!!! With this price, I would have paid more!

Heavy as a paperweight. Made to last it seems. The sound makes my iPhone sound great. No wires and size is what attracted me. I'm not in a position to judge it against others. This is the only one I've tried. I would recommend it on size wireless feature.
When I opened the package I thought it was a rip off. The thing is like a 2" cube. But, it works great. Sounds much better than expected.

reviews.review_header: I love to demonstrate it to my friends and see the ...
reviews.review_text: This technology just blew me away. How Anker is able to produce the intensity and quality of sound from this small cube is beyond me. I love to demonstrate it to my friends and see the look on their faces as the room is filled with crisp booming music. This was money well spent.

Amazed at how loud it is considering the size. Battery life is good and connectivity is easy. Only negative is it cannot be charged while playing with headphone jack inserted. Overall a great product.

reviews.review_header: However it's extremely portable and puts out some good sound. Great for those times when I just ...
reviews.review_text: It's a little power house. Ok it won't beat a Bose or a UE Boom. I have both. However it's extremely portable and puts out some good sound. Great for those times when I just want to listen to music outside the house and not lug around a bigger speake 👍👍

reviews.review_header: this little speaker is awesome. Didn't think something this small would have such ...
reviews.review_text: Wow, this little speaker is awesome. Didn't think something this small would have such a loud sound. Setup was a breeze and by its small you can put it anywhere and not even notice it. I would definitely recommend it.

Great product! Sounds good, looks good, packaging was nice & sturdy. I would recommend it to anyone. The only problem I have is that there's no volume control. I need to turn it down just a notch or 2.

I do have to admit this little thing is simply awesome. It won't connect using the newest bluetooth adapter but I suspect that's an issue with my crippled laptop. I've had to replace a dead car charger & they quickly replaced it free within the 2 year warranty. Fantastic.

reviews.review_header: Super convenient with super clear sound
reviews.review_text: Super convenient with super clear sound. Use it in our RV when boondocking, connecting to smartphones, tablets and pc. Can take it with you setting it anywhere. Just wish this unit had two way mic. Still giving it 5 starts.

For size and price, this is an amazing gadget. Do not expect $,1000 sound from a $20 speaker, but you do get about $700 worth of sound for the price! The sound became fuzzy when the tablet was over 30' away, and behind a door and a wall. Within 30' the sound remained crystal clear!

reviews.review_header: However I got free replacement from Anker that works great so far
reviews.review_text: First one didn't work properly.It was disconnection by itself every 15 minutes. However I got free replacement from Anker that works great so far.

Great product. Very compact! Long lasting battery. I use it about one hour per day and charge it once a week. I've had the chance to compare the sound to a few other products which sounded better but this definitely not the worst sounding.

This is the best little speaker ever. I listen to audible books constantly in my car which doesn't have Bluetooth and this little speaker is great. Loud enough to hear with the window down. It is so light easily carried in my purse. Friends have also purchased after seeing mine. I love it.

I never dreamed that this ring box size speaker could produce such sound and it's so wonderfully portable. I used to have to carry a boom box and CD's! Now I put my iPod and the tiny Anker speaker in my coat pocket! It actually sounds better than any other portable speaker I have ever had.

EXCEEDS EXPECTATIONS: I've heard them say that dynamite comes in a small package... WOW!!! this little speakers really delivers clear crisp and loud sound. It is sturdy, well designed and intuitive in it's operation. Highly recommended!
Great construction,decent bass,LOUD for its size,and portable yet noticeable

reviews.review_header: This is the perfect wireless speaker I ever purchased
reviews.review_text: This is the perfect wireless speaker I ever purchased.I will definitely recommend this product if someone is looking to buy a mini one.

reviews.review_header: easy to link to laptop via bluetooth
reviews.review_text: Works well, easy to link to laptop via bluetooth, sound good enough for a room full of people to listen to a lecture. Would recommend.

Great little speaker! Sound is great. It is perfect for pocket or purse. Battery life is excellent. They make perfect gifts; I gave five of them as Xmas gifts for ages twelve through seventy-two. Everyone loved them!

reviews.review_header: that's so cool, I think I could fit in my mouth ...
reviews.review_text: Our 16 old neighbor boy came over and saw it and said "Wow, that's so cool, I think I could fit in my mouth but it still sounds great! Love this speaker! Great Sounds!!

reviews.review_header: Great to carry around and very easy to use
reviews.review_text: Very compact and light. Great to carry around and very easy to use. however it does pack a lot of punch for something so small. I would definitely recommend it to any of my friends

What's not to like about this tiny speaker. For it's size it has great sound, comes packaged with everything you need, fits in my pocket when I take my walks and sounds great (yes I said that twice). Happy with this purchase.

reviews.review_header: Perfect fit in my shirt pocket while I drive a ...
reviews.review_text: Outstanding little speaker for its size !!! Second one I bought . Perfect fit in my shirt pocket while I drive a forklift at work .
I've used it three times and now it will no longer connect via Bluetooth to any device. Update: they have great customer service and sent me a replacement that is working very well.

reviews.review_header: My 14 yr old son loved it! Music plays louder than I expected and ...
reviews.review_text: My 14 yr old son loved it! Music plays louder than I expected and is extremely clear. Works wonderfully and fast delivery. Thanks!
Fantastic! Small, lightweight, holds charge well. Sound quality is fair given the size of the cube. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.review_header: and it is perfect for this environment
reviews.review_text: I use this speaker at work in my office, and it is perfect for this environment. Quality sound, reliable, and good battery life.

What an amazing profuct! Sooo loud and clear and the base is fantastic! This speakerfills a room move over Bose! Great personal for a great value! Wonderful gift idea! Nicely boxed. Anyone getting this would be pleasenly surprised!!!

reviews.review_header: Actually surprised at how good this little speaker sounds and how long the batteries ...
reviews.review_text: Actually surprised at how good this little speaker sounds and how long the batteries last. I have a AC unit in my office that is some what loud but this little speaker easily trumps the noise of the AC unit. I am using it with Iphone 5C playing podcast

reviews.review_header: ... the sound that come from it is surprisingly really good for the size of the speaker
reviews.review_text: Oh my gosh this is cutest speaker I ever seen and the sound that come from it is surprisingly really good for the size of the speaker. I love it and highly recommend it!!!

reviews.review_header: For the size and portability its wonderful - the sound is not real rich
reviews.review_text: For the size and portability its wonderful - the sound is not real rich, but it works great and is super convenient. I wish it had a volume control, but now that we know how to use it, we like it a lot.
So I finally got a chance to use this on a December cruise. Worked for 1 day, then couldn't get it to pair with phone again!
This is an Amazing little speaker! Low profile, big sound. Love it so much I just ordered another one.

I use this all the time when working on my MacBookPro (which does not have great sound - and I don't like headphones). One nice aspect is that you can place it anywhere. It is loud, sounds good, and the battery lasts for a very long time and is easy to recharge.

This thing is surprisingly loud for a speaker its size. Battery life seems to be excellent. It's sound is clearer and brighter than I expected. It's still a small speaker but sometimes it's easy to forget that. Barry
This little cube works great Bluetooth connected right away and started playing music. Sound quality is impressive definitely worth' the purchase.
Hard to believe so much great sound can come out of this small speaker. No plugs, easy to set up, rechargeable battery. Great product, especially at the low price.
Incredibly small, portable, really good battery life, and sound quality (and volume) exceeded my expectations, especially considering the size.

I have purchased other Anker products in the past and have been pleased with their performance. It was because of this that I purchased the portable speaker. I was pleased beyond expecations with the sound quality of this little speaker.

Pretty good little speaker. Plenty loud enough. It tends to need pairing fairly often. I don't know why it sometimes does not connect, even when it says it is connected. I just re-pair it, and it works fine.
I would give it a 5 star if it would have the ability to manage the volume from it. Other than that great sound, easy to pair. Does the job.

reviews.review_header: Great Wireless Speaker on a Budget
reviews.review_text: I put this thing in the room with my 10 month old and 2 year old while they go to sleep. I connect a device and stream classical music through it. Small but mighty comes to mind. It fills the room with sound. The highs are crisp and the lows are adequate. Worth every penny!

This little pup is really good. It's small, loud enough to hurt your ears in the right space, and battery last a good while. I don't guess it's meant to replace a big system, but for what it cost and it's size , it's pretty darn OK.
I'm impressed of the sound quality this tiny little ring size box gives. You will not be disappointed with this purchase.

reviews.review_header: Awesome for such a tiny speaker
reviews.review_text: Awesome for such a tiny speaker. Not a great amount of bass but it is loud. If your going to be buying something this small its about portablity more than fidelity. If you want Fidelity buy Anker's A7909 or A3143

This speaker is exactly what I was looking for!! I teach a class for 20 - 40 adults and this speaker fills the room. It arrived on-time, easy to install, easy to use, small and easy to transport. Sound it clear and larger than its size.
This is such a great help when using my IPad. I can take it anywhere in the house and still hear the sound from my IPad.

reviews.review_header: This is even better than I expected
reviews.review_text: This is even better than I expected. This has a long battery life, great sound and is so small I love how I put it anywhere. I also think it is very tough since my 2 1/2 year old has picked it up and thrown it on the carpet and nothing has happened. I highly recommend this!

reviews.review_header: the sound from this little box is awesome!!
reviews.review_text: Not kidding...the sound from this little box is awesome!!! Holds a charge for a long time (not sure how long yet because it's still running!)

Just like every other Anker products that I have bought, this seems to be built and presents the same quality. Looks great and easy to connect via Bluetooth or 3.5 mm/USB cable. I haven't tried the NFC.

I just got it & still haven't fully tested it out yet, so I give it a 4 star as of now. It seems to be a very powerful speaker for its size & over the years I grew to trust the quality of Anker products & I hope this time won't fail me!

reviews.review_header: The sound is good and it is so small you will not believe ...
reviews.review_text: I use it all the time. I have to be careful because my son tries to slip in his backpack and take it to school. I will buy another. The sound is good and it is so small you will not believe it.
This thing is awesome! It is so powerful I can use it in the car and it sounds louder than the speakers. Note that the sound gets distorted if you push it to the max.

reviews.review_header: This device is amazing; a loudspeaker in a 1-1/2 inch cube
reviews.review_text: This device is amazing; a loudspeaker in a 1-1/2 inch cube. Excellent sound reproduction. I use it to listen to radio or music while I'm in the shower. It's plenty loud enough to drown out the noise of the water. Really good.

Can't believe the sound that comes from such a little speaker. My only problem now is trying not to lose it. The wired connection via headphone jack works well too. Like that I can pause the music by pressing the power switch.

Great sound and easy to use. The only drawback to this little fellow is that you can't control the volume or which song is playing by the speaker. It connects very easy has a nice, one-touch pause action.
very cool little speaker! Super portable Bluetooth is awesome! Sound quality is awesome for its size. It loud for its size too. I definitely would recommend this to anyone!

Love all Anker products! Bought this a few months ago and have used this extensively. It pairs well with Bluetooth and is loud and sound is clear. Bass could be improved but for its size it is adequate. Will be buying more for gifts

This little bluetooth speaker is well worth the price I paid for. The sound is just right and it's loudness. Small enough to fit in your pocket or even a clutch purse it would make a great gift. I still plan to get another one.

I'll give it 5 stars. it compact, nice clear sound, and the price is right!. I actually might get a few for gifts. oh I almost forgot the quality of the build and little accent light to show status is very clean and well designed. I'm impressed.

Just as I expected. Good sound from such a tiny thing. Sits nicely on the laptop for streaming movies. While battery time is good, just wish there was more of a warning. It did not stop what I was doing. Highly recommend for this type of application.
I had some problems getting it to connect but it seems to work fine. A little tinny, but good for a very small speaker.
You get what you pay for and this is it .....and then some! Definitely does the job!

reviews.review_header: The sound quality is amazing, it looks small but the audio it put ...
reviews.review_text: The sound quality is amazing, it looks small but the audio it put outs its great. I'm very happy and impressed.

reviews.review_header: Have good hearing? Get something else.
reviews.review_text: High pitched buzzing noise any time using bluetooth. Appears to be an issue with the product that only a small percentage of people can hear. Needs more work on the design to make it functional for ALL users.

reviews.review_header: Great sound in a tiny package.
reviews.review_text: Amazingly loud sound! I purchased a second for my wife. I use mine to have some music while I travel. She uses hers with her MacBook to do presentations for work.
I like it.I use it when I can't get good reception on my HD radio from WLRN classical radio,in south Florida .

reviews.review_header: Big sound for a small device
reviews.review_text: Bought this speaker based on a friend having the slightly larger version. it works great and is nice and small, easy to carry. Comes with a nice carry bag, USB cord. Really like it. Have used it in a classroom and it produces nice big sound!
I push a cart around getting supplies In a warehouse so can't wait to use this to keep motivation. Thank you!
Very good and potent sound from a very small device! And love its portability!

reviews.review_header: best speaker and for its size amazing!!
reviews.review_text: Fantastc little speaker...as loud as my sona wave computer speakers I have ...excellent sound for the speakers size...easy to bluetooth and stays charged for a really long time..well made and better sound than 40 dollar speaker I tried before and returned...I love it!!!!

reviews.review_header: A lot of sound for a little box
reviews.review_text: I gave my daughter one of these as a gift. I was amazed at the sound this little box can produce and bought another for myself. It syncs easily with my computer and makes watching a movie on my laptop much more enjoyable.

reviews.review_header: It's so small but it will surprise you.
reviews.review_text: This little speaker will surprise you. It's much louder than I expected. It does lack a punch and clarity but I can't expect much from this little thing.
This is a very handy product. Small, rechargable, good battery life, easy to pair. Of course it doesn't have much bass but it's better than a cell phone speaker. Very happy with it.
Bought this as a gift for a friend. Despite its small size, it is quite loud. This purchase definitely exceeded my expectations and I would gladly buy this again.

reviews.review_header: Excellent product. Hope Anker will keep the quality and ...
reviews.review_text: Excellent product. Hope Anker will keep the quality and the value on that level for a long time This is my third product made by Anker. Love this company.

reviews.review_header: One of the best little gadgets I've ever brought!!
reviews.review_text: This is one of the best products that I have ever brought. I use it at my office and do not have to worry about any cords (only when to recharge). The sound is great. I am going to buy another one for my house.
It is so small but it is amazing! I got it for my mom I am definitely getting the ne version for me since I have 3 kids. I am sure it is going to get wet some how.

reviews.review_header: Great for audiobooks or podcasts where you just listen to ...
reviews.review_text: Well-made but too dull-sounding. Great for audiobooks or podcasts where you just listen to someone's voice. Not so great for listening to music. Not enough highs and too much lows
This is a geat little speaker. So portable and sounds powerful out on a kayak!

This little guys worked great at first. I was very impressed with how loud and small it is. But it VERY quickly started to produce inconsistent sound and need more and more frequent charging. Thinking of returning it.
We have taken this little speaker to events at work, outdoor picnics, even in the car. It is powerful yet super tiny! No fuss technology. Love it!
Muy bueno! No volume control on it but I expected that & use the phone's volume. Small, good battery life, good sound. Pleasant little noises for its different power and connection states.

reviews.review_header: This thing is awesome. Loud as hell
reviews.review_text: This thing is awesome. Loud as hell. I use it in the bathroom and it's so small I can carry it out around the house really easily to any room that doesn't have speakers, super useful. Great build quality too, built like a rock. Love it!

A nice little unit. A volume control would have been nice, but battery time and sound are good as i. Price/quality is especially noticeable. Lots of units at this price around, but not with this level of quality.

reviews.review_header: Nice but missing cable play and charge
reviews.review_text: Nice gadget but lacks the option to play via aux cable and charge in the same time. And it just won't pait with my Galaxy S6.

reviews.review_header: The sound quality is very good. No static or background interference
reviews.review_text: This little speaker is surprising. The sound quality is very good. No static or background interference. Is very light and great for carrying around. It is perfect for taking out in service.
nice sound for a little speaker but not a showstopper sound by any means
I've had this for a year and love it. I take it everywhere and people always are amazed at the quality.

reviews.review_header: this is the best small speaker that I​ ever have
reviews.review_text: this is the best small speaker that I​ ever have! just awesome.... its sound very loud and clear, and the battery last forever :)
Surprised how loud it is compared to its size!!
This is my second mini speaker and it's way better than the last. Sound is great. Holds a long charge and it's too cute! This brand is superior, by far.
I hate it is need to do a return

reviews.review_header: Great portable speaker; wish more warning before it runs out of power
reviews.review_text: This was my first Anker product and I have bought two more products from them since. It's a great little speaker and very portable. Only complaint is I'd like more warning before the battery is about to die.
Great portable speaker. I travel a lot and like to pack light and this speaker is perfect. Plenty of sound for hotel rooms and lounging by the water.

This packs a powerful punch in such a small box. Sound quality is pretty good, not the greatest, which is expected. This is more for if you want tunes in your backyard while having a fire, or music on the go. I absolutely love it.
Quality ! I have had larger portable speaker for over a year, both are great. Use for portable radio outside
little speaker. powerful sound.

Just great!! I had one of those X-Mini II speakers (the little ball) which is also great but this one is even better and a little smaller. Not to mention the bluetooth ability. Great to take to the pool, beach or just to listen at home. Get it, you won't regret!

Great sound for such small speaker and the reach very good much more than expected. Great buy, come with a little storage pouch. I have multiple anger products so I was sure this would be as good as my other products from them.
really great sound, very small, holds a charge for quite some time. Sometimes my computer does "forget" the device but I'll assume that's my laptop and not the speaker.
Anker makes such awesome stuff! Love this little box. Nice and loud (for its size) and great battery life. Great speaker.
Awesome sound. Not much bass, but who cares. It has a crisp sound quality, portable, decent battery life and not expensive

reviews.review_header: The size and portability were also great.
reviews.review_text: I bought this speaker wanting to get an upgrade on my built in phone speakers. It definitely did this and for the price you can't beat it! The size and portability were also great.

reviews.review_header: very nice sound and holds a charge for a long time
reviews.review_text: compact size, reasonably priced, very nice sound and holds a charge for a long time. A great item
This speaker is amazing. I teach a group of youth and there are videos to play off my iPad. Sometimes the sound isn't enough but this really boosts the sound. It's a great little speaker.

reviews.review_header: For the price it is a great little wireless speaker with plenty of sound
reviews.review_text: For the price it is a great little wireless speaker with plenty of sound. It's so small I forget I have it in my backpack and I'm not as concerned if I loose it because I buy another one at this great price.
Best portable Bluetooth speaker I have. Sound is as good as larger, more expensive of this size.
Great sound easy to use! Very happy with product. Got it to replace bulky old stereo, perfect.

reviews.review_header: Big sound from a little package!
reviews.review_text: I love this little thing! I can't believe how much sound comes out of this speaker! Easy to set up, my phone found it in a matter of seconds. No regrets! Would buy again in a heartbeat!

reviews.review_header: This little speaker is amazing. size is on point with dimensions of a ...
reviews.review_text: This little speaker is amazing. size is on point with dimensions of a ring box. very easy to pair with devices, turn on, control of volume. Sound is sharp and clear. only gripe is that the bass is a bit low, but it is easily overlooked.

reviews.review_header: I bought this item atleast 3 times because I love it so much!
reviews.review_text: I've purchase these atleast 3 more times to give as gifts to friends and family. I think this is an amazing portable speaker with great sound.
Love this pint sized powerful speaker! The sound quality is great. I would definitely purchase this again.

reviews.review_header: ... problems with the sound cutting off or it sounding like it's buffering so you might need to see whether ...
reviews.review_text: I sometimes have problems with the sound cutting off or it sounding like it's buffering so you might need to see whether putting it closer or farther from where the music is coming from will give you the best sound.
This little box has an amazing big sound; my buy of the decade!!!

reviews.review_header: I use this with my Tablet when watching movies and ...
reviews.review_text: I use this with my Tablet when watching movies and it really adds to the sound. After using only the speaker on the tablet this is quite an improvement.
Works like a charm with great volume and very little distortion when turned up loud. Also purchased Anker blue poolside wireless speaker. Don't make any splashes or you won't hear the blue one.

reviews.review_header: So it's better for books on tape than for music but you ...
reviews.review_text: small, simple, loud enough, set up a snap. Lacking in bass but that's to be expected from its size. So it's better for books on tape than for music but you probably can't do better for the price and size.

reviews.review_header: This little cube is a lot of bang for the ...
reviews.review_text: This little cube is a lot of bang for the buck. Use it on long drives listening to audible books, car too old for Bluetooth.

reviews.review_header: Good sound, compact and light speaker
reviews.review_text: The speaker is of good quality and has a good sound experience. Only wish Anker had added volume control buttons and allowed for taking phone calls via the bluetooth speaker.

reviews.review_header: Small and easy to carry music speaker
reviews.review_text: Small and easy to carry music speaker. Set up was easy and working fine. You definitely get more for what you paid. Music sound is good enough to listen and is loud. Happy with the purchased.

I love this speaker. All of my friends comment on how loud and clear it sounds. The sound quality is great and the battery lasts a looong time. I take it camping and use it for a couple of days without a recharge and the battery holds up fine.
Love my Anker ring box size Bluetooth speaker.I purchased this little gem to use for traveling and am amazed at the sound coming from this tiny speaker.

It's surprisingly loud for a small speaker as it is. I even listened to this outside when I was working and I could hear it fine. Inside a room you can have a party and still hear it. Bass is ok but you can't expect much from such a small speaker

PRO : Use for 2 months now. It's tiny but so loud. It's louder than my Sony SRS-BTV5. The sound so great. It's my Note 4 's companion now. CON : Tag with NFC mobile phone can't auto power on the device. Not back pocket friendly :D
This mini speaker may not be the best in audio quality but it does the job just fine and is actually pretty loud for such a small device. The battery is top notch, it'll last you a while.

reviews.review_header: Sounds great! Battery life is good
reviews.review_text: Sounds great! Battery life is good. Can listen all day with no problem. I like it so much I bought 2 more to give as gifts.
Nice gadget!!!
Amazing little personal sound cube. Great midrange presence. I use it outdoors, sitting on a low table a few feet from me and it sounds great.

reviews.review_header: Small and easy to carry around
reviews.review_text: Small and easy to carry around. Sounds great. For everyday use with my laptop and my cell phone. I like it.
I haven't used it for a long period of time, but the sound is great!. Very small speaker, and super easy to pair with your devices. Good product!

Awesome product. I was in rock and roll bands for 12 years, and have a have a appreciation for good fidelity. Sonos, Bose, etc. The sound quality that comes out of this little cube is very impressive.

reviews.review_header: This product is amazing. They are a 2 inch speaker with a ...

reviews.review_header: Decent portable speaker - just don't expect great results via bluetooth UPDATE 6-13-15
reviews.review_text: Although I this was my 5th Anker purchase in a little over a month, it was unfortunately the worst. I have 4 other Anker products that perform flawlessly and provide a tremendous value compared to other competitors. I do not like to give 1 star reviews for any products, but unfortunately the main function of this tiny little speaker is flawed - the bluetooth audio quality. The product packaging and quality is top notch and simply cannot be beat for the money. The speaker is small and comes with a charging usb cable and usb-to-3.5mm cable if you decide not to use bluetooth - which I recommend. Upon receiving this product I immediately paired it with my iPhone 6 and it was as simple as can be. The speaker is able to reach a loud volume with ease but I immediately noticed a high level of buzzing and distortion. I know that bluetooth audio is a lossless codec, but this was not the typical sound associated with bluetooth speakers. The sound was dull and lackluster, something that appeared to differ from other Amazon reviews I read before purchasing. The primary reason for my purchase was for a small bluetooth speaker to take to work and have on my workstation for occasionally listening to music and podcasts as time permits. Unfortunately the sound quality via bluetooth was actually worse than the built-in speaker on my iPhone 6. The sound quality is better when utilized with the included usb to 3.5mm cable but that defeats the entire wireless functionality of the device. In recent days I have noticed similar complaints from others users complaining about sound quality and buzzing via bluetooth so I fear that there may be some defective units out there and recommend buying with caution. UPDATE 6-13-15: I have continued to use this speaker occasionally at work and have adjusted my rating accordingly. Although it still does not deliver the sound quality I expected, it works well for podcasts or spoken audio. It has held up nicely after throwing it in my backpack with other objects. For the price and size I guess there must be some trade-offs. I upgraded my score to 3 stars, but more realistically I would give it 2.5.

reviews.review_header: Tiny speaker with guts, but can't charge and listen at the same time on AUX in.
reviews.review_text: PROs: Tiny speaker with guts...good bluetooth sound. CONs: Only one port on this speaker for both charging and AUX input (micro-USB). The manufacturer fails to explain this in any of the detail description notes or even show a picture of the backside of the device. I was hoping to use this speaker as a low profile PC speaker and just leave it plugged in all the time. That is impossible because of the dual function micro-USB port they engineered into the speaker. You can either 1) plug it into your AUX listening device using the somewhat obscure cable they provide which is micro-USB on one end and 1/8" stereo plug on the other end, OR 2) you can charge it with the supplied USB to micro-USB cable. I already have the Anker A7908 Portable bluetooth speaker that I use on my desk and was hoping this A7910 Ultra Portable would be of similar construction with both charging and AUX in ports on the back. However, if you intend to use this speaker out and about and charge between uses, I suspect it fills that market point just fine. I just hope you don't expect to listen and charge at the same time if you depend a cable for AUX input. I'm giving it 3 stars because of the lack of detail given on how the single port works for dual functions. If they had been more clear about this from the start, I would have found another solution instead of wasting my time purchasing this one, only to return it.

Update: Bumped to 5 stars. Installed an equalizer on my Moto X (2013), and now the music simply sounds better/right to my ears. The stock equalizer/audio effects did nothing for Bluetooth connections, but after installing a 3rd party equalizer that did, the sound is simply wonderful. Turn up the volume, set the equalizer to a standard Rock preset ... and you can feel the bass resonate in my fingers while the treble just sounds right. I still can't say it matches the quality of a much more expensive and larger speaker ... but this thing is more then enough for me. I'm not going to be hunting for another bluetooth speaker after all unless its a G-Boom specifically for heavy bass ... and that isn't happening anytime soon. Pros: Tiny size, long battery life, nice sound, has bass, feels solid, easily portable. Cons: No microphone, no physical buttons beyond power, special micro-usb cable to get Aux Sound in. Well worth the $22 I threw at it when looking for a new speaker. It won't replace surround sound systems or the like, but for something portable? Its great. Original Review First impression: The treble could be better. I'm not an audiophile, in fact I tend to have hearing problems (ear infection as a child), so quality is sometimes lost on me. Still, part of me at first wanted to think that something in the upper frequencies was flat or missing. Further Impressions: I'm keeping it. First, it does get loud filling a room completely with sound and where you may not want to stay near it when its at max volume for long. It hits roughly 90 decibels in volume at max on my phone. It feels solid, as something I won't be worried about getting destroyed easily, but still not something I'd risk spiking into the ground ... but what electronic is? Sound quality wise, it won't match an expensive and larger speaker, of course, but its quite enjoyable. Bass is there even if it doesn't quite have the "Boom" I'm used too, but it will cause things nearby to vibrate. Treble as I said in my first impression seems to be missing something, probably the higher frequencies, but acceptable. At max volume, there is no distortion. Size wise? Its tiny. It won't fit in a normal pants pocket, but a coat or cargo pocket will carry this thing easily. Placing it anywhere doesn't take much, due to the small footprint and the fact it won't rattle itself off the shelf or counter. Battery life? Played ambient sound while I was sleeping during the night when I first got it (Thunderstorms), and it was still running when I woke up in the morning on my day off of work ... meaning 10 hours of sleep. REALLY respectable battery life, so don't expect to need to plug it in often unless you are running it day to night to day (even then it only needs an hour and a half to top up). Conclusion: Well worth the money spent. I'm tempted to still buy a UE Mini-Boom or Boom, but I'm keeping this little speaker for other purposes. Its easier to carry around, no worries about getting it stolen or lost (price difference), the battery lasts for a long time, and the sound is quite nice especially for the size. With this, getting a higher quality/expensive bluetooth speaker isn't on my priority list but rather something if a massive discount sale happens. The A7910 definitely is my casual carrying speaker now, and anything else I may buy will probably be geared more towards large bluetooth speakers with a built-in subwoofer for bass at the cost of not being easily carried.

Purchased for use with my Raspberry Pi 3 for a custom project. Using Rasbian/Ubuntu easily able to connect with the native Bluetooth on the board and switch audio with a quick config file change. Sounds wonderful. Was not able to use it for RetroPie via Bluetooth but that is an issue with the distribution not this speaker. With that said however, you can use the nice little 2.5mm to mini-USB audio chord with the Pi's audio jack and it sounds just fine. For anyone using Rasbian or most other distros for the Pi, edit the config.txt file under /boot/config.txt to include: disable_audio_dither=1 This will clean up the generally not great audio output of the Pi and make it sound as it should. This little speaker has a lot more life than I'd figure such a tiny box would have. Awesome and definitely going to keep in mind for future Pi related projects.

reviews.review_header: Died after 12 hours - Replacement works very well
reviews.review_text: This is potentially a great little speaker. The sound is remarkably good. But the blue light indicating it was working never came on and after the first recharge the speaker died. It was not even a door stop - it's too light. Perhaps this is just a speaker that was missed by Anker's quality control. It's performance is so good, assuming it works, that I'll replace it and see if a new one works. if it does I'll update the review. But I have a lot of external speakers and they've all lasted for years not hours. Updated 4/27/15 - I bought a new Cube. Anker gave me a partial credit. The first one had a defective on-off button. This one works great - so far. The Bluetooth function is remarkable; it works when the speaker and device are as much as 30 feet away. The speaker and my iPod did lose connectivity once, but I was able to reconnect the Cube in less than 30 seconds with a quick trip to the iPod's settings menu. I'll buy a second one and maybe a third. The speaker is so light and sounds so good.

reviews.review_header: Wow! Impressively loud and super easy to use! This one is a winner!
reviews.review_text: Wow! I am impressed with the sound that comes out of this little speaker. It's not only very loud for its size, but it sound really good! I bought it as an alternative to my MacBook Pro's (MBP) internal speakers. I blew one of the internal speakers, and since I plan on buying a new MBP in a few months, I didn't see the wisdom in paying to have it fixed. So I decided to get an external speaker. My requirements were that the external speaker had to be very small and inexpensive. This speaker is definitely small, being about 50% larger than a square ice cube. I also like the rubberized outer coating. It looks great and is very comfortable to pick up and move around. Next, I discovered how easy this speaker is to use. It comes with two cables, one for the speaker jack and another for the USB port. I wanted to hear what it sounds like right away so I plugged in the speaker cable. It was definitely much louder than I expected! I had to turn the sound way down on my MBP. Then I decided to try out the bluetooth feature. It paired with my MBP in just a second, and suddenly I had a completely wireless little speaker! The sound is very loud for such a tiny speaker. I used to have to double the sound output on my iTunes TV shows and then have the sound on my MBP set to the loudest possible setting (may be why I eventually blew a speaker?). The sound coming from this little speaker is at least 4x louder. I don't have to double the output on the iTunes TV shows at all; plus, I only have the sound level set to maybe 1/3 to 1/2 of the way up. And even then the sound is much louder than what I was getting using my MBP's speakers. If I turn the sound up a little more, it can fill the entire room so that I can move around and still hear ever word. The sound loudness reminds me of the loudness on a TV set. It's definitely plenty loud! The sound quality is very clear. The base is surprisingly good, as well. It cannot compare to the base on a large stereo, but for the size and price, that's to be expected. Still, the base is good enough to enjoy the sound, including songs played during tv shows. There is no distortion whatsoever. I haven't had to charge it yet. It's been playing for about 18 hours so far (some of that time it's merely turned on, but the MBP went to sleep). I'm waiting for it to tell me to charge it. I expect it will charge simply enough. I love how long the battery's lasting so far. I know I'll get at least the 12 hours advertised once I actually charge it. Overall, this little speaker packs a real punch. If you're looking for a hifi stereo to boom music throughout a large room, this is not the speaker for you. Pay at least 10x the price to get that kind of performance. But if you want a small speaker that's super easy to use with loud and very clear sound, this is the one you want. I'm very happy I got it and recommend it highly!

reviews.review_header: Little speaker with great sound perfect to travel internationally!
reviews.review_text: This little speaker has been fantastic! I wanted something to listen to music while in my office, and a bluetooth speaker that would travel internationally rather easily. So, the small size is incredibly important. My daughter got me a no-name brand inexpensive BT speaker for Christmas, but within 1 month it started playing static under the music almost all the time (that drove me nuts!). I bought this on a whim, knowing that Anker has good products (from my previous purchases) and I could return it if I didn't like it. Wow, was I surprised at the sound that came out of this little speaker. It paired immediately with my phone (and later my laptop when needed), and gave clear, crisp sound (including some bass that I didn't expect). It can get quite loud for my office (thankful that I work in a basement office with no other co-workers to bother). Traveling with this is fantastic! The little bag it comes with keeps it scratch-free, and it's small and light enough to toss into my backpack with my other electronics. Pairing with my laptop for presentations (which include videos) has been wonderful - just used it for a conference in Canada with about 25 people in the room. We ended up using it for everyone's presentation, since there was no sound system in the room and this was loud enough for all to hear! I'm looking forward to traveling around the world with this little guy. In fact, I just had a few partners from Africa here for a visit, and they loved the speaker so much that I bought one for each of them as a gift. For less than $20, this is a great deal for a great bluetooth speaker!!!

This is a review of three Anker products that I just purchased, the Ultra Portable Pocket sized Wireless Speaker, the USB 3.0 4-Port Portable Aluminum Hub, and the Aluminum multi-angle Universal Phone and Tablet stand. All three products have that characteristic beautiful Anker packaging with even the wrapping sleeves perfectly creased making the unboxing a delight in the anticipation of quality. Anker doesn't disappoint. The ultra portable speaker is so tiny and a joy to hold in the palm of your hand that my only reaction was, if only they included a storage bag with it. On closer inspection, I realized that, indeed, tucked away in a neat cardboard partition of the insert, there was a very plush micro-fiber pouch which contained a charging cable and a uUSB line in adapter for a wired non-bluetooth connection. Paring of the speaker was effortless by holding down the power button for 2 seconds until the blue LED starts blinking and instantly recognized by my iPhone 6. Wow, was I impressed with the sound and volume from such a tiny package. Did I say I was impressed? 12 hour play time and crystal clear midrange and highs with an edgy sound capable only from a low distortion very rigid driver. Of course the lows were rolled off as to be expected from a 1" driver, but wasn't that evident because of the clarity and detail remaining in the music. I look forward to trying out this little guy's big brother which has a 4" driver. For the price and portability (great for travel), this tiny speaker has no peer. I highly recommend it. Next up is the stylish and Apple-esque styled Aluminum USB 3.0 hub. Ergonomics are perfect with wide spacing for the USB ports so that larger cables and devices can comfortably sit in their spots. The 2' cable is a perfect length to get to my monitor mounted Apple mini and sit in a perfectly accessible location on my desk. And with USB 3.0 speeds, what's not to like? Highly recommended. Finally, the Aluminum Multi-Angle Phone and Tablet stand is a joy to behold. It has the same elegantly machined aluminum as the hub and has more than enough latched (button enabled) angle settings for either my iPhone or my iPad mini to rest comfortably and solidly on my desk. Highly recommended. Did I say, I love Anker products?

I bought this to hook up to my computer, as I just got a desktop computer which did not come with speakers. I wanted something small but good quality. This speaker works fine and doesn't produce any static, but the sound quality is just OK - a little bit tinny sounding. It could use more base. Maybe there's a way to adjust this in my computer? The problem I had with my other speaker was that the cord was not long enough so when I saw this had blue tooth technology, I thought that solved the problem. However, for some reason the blue tooth keeps disconnecting. It's annoying that I have to keep reconnecting it. So I ended up just using the cord to plug it in to my computer, but I wish the cord was a bit longer. Update: I returned this speaker and Anker contacted me to offer a free replacement. I accepted. I had already gotten a different speaker so I gave it to my husband to use. He said that he connected the blue tooth to his phone and it works great, however when he tried to connect it to his laptop, it could not find it. So I don't know if the problem is with his computer or the speaker. Anyway the customer service is excellent from this company and they really do want to make sure you are happy with your purchase.

reviews.review_header: Really not much better than sticking the end of the phone in a ...
reviews.review_text: Very weak sound output. Really not much better than sticking the end of the phone in a toilet paper tube. Updated Review: This small speaker still has miserably poor sound. However, I was very pleased that Anker was willing to exchange it for the A7908 which is significantly larger and sounds like a real speaker. The A7908 is bigger than I wanted, but well worth the improved sound quality. Thumbs up to Anker for being proactive at resolving customer satisfaction issues. I've bought quite a few Anker products over the past couple years and they have all been high build quality and as a result I'm pretty confident in recommending the brand itself. (though not this particular pocket size speaker)

Dissapointed in this product by Anker. Sound quality is quite low. It sounds good for playing jazz or blues music heavy on vocal however would not recommend for pop and rock or alternative. The speakers sound staticky :(. Furthermore the Bluetooth is horrible. I originally bought this to listen to my audiobooks however the Bluetooth does not do good picking up short intervals of sound such as the narrator stoping and speaking. When on Bluetooth the speaker cuts the words' first parts. For example while originally it should read: "Running around the boy danced". From the speaker it comes out as " 'unning 'round the boy 'anced" however this problem does not occur when plugged into the aux cord. To sum it up: -not good for amplifying pop or rock music (staticky) -good for soft jazz or vocal -not good to use with Bluetooth when listening to audiobooks (music seems to be fine though) -very loud volume -very light however box shape inconvinient to carry around -aesthetically pleasing -battery time .... Eh. It lasts more like 6 hrs than 12. Would I recommend it? No. There are better speakers out there. Keep looking :)

For the size you'll be surprised at how loud it gets. I think this is the best 20 bucks I've spent on tech. Its constructed in a black matte soft touch plastic with a rubber bottom so it won't move around on slick surfaces. Its tiny I've gone hiking with it playing music in my pocket. And anker always has great customer service.

The sound quality of this tiny speaker amazes me. I was expecting static and less base since this speaker is so small and compact. reviews.review_header: *Updated* Bluetooth interference makes a good speaker annoying to listen to.
reviews.review_text: Received this little guy today and it really does have an impressive sound for it's size. Super easy to pair with any bluetooth device and the added convenience of NFC makes this quite the deal. However, I am experiencing some interference with bluetooth playback. I haven't experienced this with any of my other bluetooth speakers and it goes away when I use the auxiliary-to-micro usb cable. It's a subtle high-pitched tone that not everyone may be able to distinguish easily, but it makes this speaker pretty much unusable for me. I've emailed Anker and I'll keep everyone posted! Update #1: Anker customer support has been top notch. I received multiple emails asking about the interference and they seem committed to fixing the product. They offered to either exchange it or give me a full refund. +1 star for great customer service! Update #2: I received the replacement unit yesterday and unfortunately it has the same issue. At this point I'm going to assume this is a flaw with the product and not a defect with just the speaker I received. I've packaged both speakers in one box and plan to send it back first thing Monday.

reviews.review_header: A lot of sound from a small speaker isn't always a great thing.
reviews.review_text: This is a nice speaker and has a lot of sound in a small package. Unfortunately, it has a lot of sound in a small package; and no volume control aside from your device. Look at the Anker Classic Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker, Powerful Sound with Enhanced Bass, 20 Hour Battery Life, and Built-in Mic, works with iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Nexus, HTC, Laptops and More (Black) . It's a little bigger but has a deeper sound and more flexibility. I'll explain. I wanted a speaker to use in the office or at home when going to sleep. Every device I've tried (iphone, ipod, ipad, galaxy s4) plays way too loud on this for either setting. I would turn down to the lowest setting and it would still be really loud. On the apple devices, I would even use my finger on the bottom tray and get the slider half way between zero and the lowest setting. Still too loud. Moved it off my nightstand to the dresser across the room, and it was still quite loud even when competing with the furnace. In the office, I was worried people would come over and complain, especially when louder songs would come on. If this had a volume control and could go a little quieter, it would be an awesome speaker. I ended up putting it in the baby's stroller, and it makes a very cool "car radio" kind of setup. Fits in the snap compartment and provides plenty of sound to be heard when walking to the park or on the bike path. It's an impressive speaker if you want a lot of sound in a small package, but overpowering if you don't want that much sound. I do like Anker, their support is great and for the value the bigger speaker is comparable to the UE BOOM Wireless Bluetooth Speaker - Black , or OontZ Angle PLUS Portable Wireless Water Resistant Bluetooth Speaker, (BLACK), by Cambridge SoundWorks [Newer Upgraded Model Available Now: Search Amazon for OontZ Angle 3 ] (also a great speaker) in terms of sound and usefulness.

Received as a gift today. Usually, if I even get around to writing a review, it isn't until prompted by Amazon, but this speaker is so cool, I couldn't wait to gush! Plus, the decision to place an order was based on only 14 Amazon reviews, which was a leap of faith, IMO, so I'm here to reassure anyone out there who might be hesitant like me. As far as the instructions go, not much to know before using: 1) power on by holding button down 3sec. 2) control volume with device, in my case my iPhone. 3) already charged out of the box, but when 12 hr charge is used up (voice supposedly annouces low battery) have it powered off while charging to protect the battery. For newbies out there, pairing is simple--and a one-time thing. * Go into Settings on your phone or tablet and turn on Bluetooth. * Have the speaker by your phone and within seconds "Anker A7910" appears. Tap on it to connect. * To pair with another device, make sure you've turned off the Bluetooth temporarily on your first device. In my case, pairing would not occur on the iPad until I turned off Bluetooth on the iPhone. The sound quality SHOCKED us. It was so good! I'm not sure what shocked me more, the sound quality or it's tiny size! It was like a double whammy: "Look how small it is! ... Omg, it sounds great!" We just bought ourselves a Bluetooth speaker a month ago, Sony SRS-X5, which got great reviews and we are very pleased with it. Then I got on a Bluetooth craze and wanted something small enough to fit in my pocket while walking the dog, etc., so my daughter did the research and this Anker speaker was the tiniest one she could find and figured for $23 it was worth the gamble, especially with an 18 month warranty. As I sit here listening to this Anker, I'm kind of wishing I could return the $130 (on sale) Sony and keep the little guy! Seriously. I can see using this in the house as well and being nearly as satisfied. True, the sound to an audiophile will be better on the Sony, but for my purposes I'd rather be $100 richer! At this time in our lives, when you have just about everything you need, this made the PERFECT gift. New to me or Nice to know: * while listening to music, you will still hear your text msg alerts. * turns itself off after about ten minutes if you turn off your device's Bluetooth, giving an audible beep as it powered off, as it did when powering on, and when it connected. * if you have Bluetooth turned on, on all of your devices, the Anker will automatically connect with the last device it had been connected to previously. * nice rubberized base keeps it secure on tabletop * came with a small sturdy protective pouch, and I could hear the sound just as well through its fabric. Since it'll be carried in my pocket most often, I may just keep it in the pouch all the time. You can feel the power button through the fabric, so turning it on will be a breeze. The only downside so far is not knowing how much battery is left. But that's not a biggie. I might just get into the habit of charging it overnight every night as I found no warning in the instructions to wait until battery fully discharged. P.S. I promise to update if my feelings change, but for now I'm in love! P.P.S. May 2015. Still loving it

reviews.review_header: Small Size - Big Sound! It is awful cute and it sounds great!
reviews.review_text: This is an amazing little Bluetooth speaker. It only weighs in a 3.17 ounces but this little speaker can get the job done in playing your music, audio books, videos or your recorded lessons. You can charge this speaker's internal battery in 1 ½ to 3 hours and it will provide up to 12 hours of continuous play time with one charge. You can charge it with your computer's USB port, an AC USB wall charger or a vehicle USB charger. It is rated at 5VDC at ½ Amp but you can use a higher current like 1 amp. It features Bluetooth 3.0 connection for the wireless transmission of the audio to the speaker and it also has NFC (Near Field Connection) capabilities. Its connection distance is up to 33 feet. It comes with an Auxiliary cable that is 31 inches long, a 32 inch long charging cable, a nice velour carrying bag and an instruction manual. It comes with an Anker 18 month warranty. The speaker produces very good sounds and good volume for its size. It utilizes a 3 watt audio speaker. The speaker does not have a volume control and you adjust the volume output level by using the volume controls of the device you are using to create the sounds. You will see this in my video. Pairing the speaker is fast and easy and I also show how to do that in my video. The speaker does not include a microphone so you have to make your phone calls using your phone. It still is awful cute and it sounds great. The unit can fit into your pocket, purse, backpack or computer bag. It is made to travel and keep you company and supply your entertainment needs while you are on the move. Highly portable, good sound, good warranty and sold at a good price. I gave it a 5 star rating. I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation. A review was not promised to the supplier in exchange for the sample but I stated that if I provided a review that it would be fair and honest.
